text: In case you have already opened a printout in POS(making it not being shown in the DDD POS printouts anymore) and need to see it again, in case of a reprint etc. It can be found following this path in file explorer: c:/POS/Reports Sort after newest to see what has been printed out most recently
title: Accessing earlier printouts from POS (RIAB)
description:
In case you have already opened a printout in POS(making it not being shown in the DDD POS printouts anymore) and need to see it again, in case of a reprint etc. It can be found following this path in file explorer: 



c:/POS/Reports



Sort after newest to see what has been printed out most recently

text: Sometime,the clerk or shop staff wants to print a report which shows all the records when was the cash drawer opened. It is possible to print a report where it shows all the tracks when was the cash drawer opened in the shop. The procedure is as follows. Login to the POS Go to shortcut then select Reports. Choose the period of the report you want to print Press Receipt log A receipt will be printed from recipt printer including all logs about opening of the cash drawer.
title: Cash drawer opening Report.
description:
Sometime,the clerk or shop staff wants to print a report which shows all the records when was the cash drawer opened.

It is possible to print a report where it shows all the tracks when was the cash drawer opened in the shop.

The procedure is as follows.

Login to the POS
Go to shortcut
then select Reports.
Choose the period of the report you want to print
Press Receipt log
A receipt will be printed from recipt printer including all logs about opening of the cash drawer.

text: 1. Log in on POS with a user with administrator rights. 2. Click the Screen-with-wrench button 3. Choose store and machine, then click Change this machine only 4. Scroll down to Adv. Configuration and click it. 5. Scroll down to find Change fixed date and add the new date 6. Scroll down to the bottom of the page, click Save and then click Close Back on the POS, click the Cancel Sale button, type reload in the sales assistant field and click the green button. Once the clock down in the righthand corner of the POS starts running again, log back in and test it.
title: Change fixed exchange date on receipts
description:
1. Log in on POS with a user with administrator rights.


2. Click the Screen-with-wrench button


3. Choose store and machine, then click Change this machine only


4. Scroll down to Adv. Configuration and click it.


5. Scroll down to find Change fixed date and add the new date



6. Scroll down to the bottom of the page, click Save and then click Close


Back on the POS, click the Cancel Sale button, type reload in the sales assistant field and click the green button.


Once the clock down in the righthand corner of the POS starts running again, log back in and test it.

text: Type list in the Sales Assistant field on the POS to get the below list: 999 + 70223010 (pw) – Shuts down the POS program reload – Refreshes the POS program, if you have made changes and don't want to wait for them to take effect (doesn't work for the creation of new shop assistants. You have to wait about 10 minutes for them to turn up) restart – to restart the POS program 333 – Minimizes the POS program restartpc – restarts PC list – shows this list of shortcuts changepull – A slightly more advanced way of updating the POS than reload. Take longer to load. 998 – Test login for the POS export + receiptnumber – sends receipts to BO again, if they haven't gone through maintainPOS.exe – updates POS to the latest version updatechart – updates the chart, if there's a problem with the turnover numbers
title: Commands to refresh the POS
description:
Type list in the Sales Assistant field on the POS to get the below list:


999 + 70223010 (pw) – Shuts down the POS program 

  

reload – Refreshes the POS program, if you have made changes and don't want to wait for them to take effect (doesn't work for the creation of new shop assistants. You have to wait about 10 minutes for them to turn up) 

  

restart – to restart the POS program 

  

333 – Minimizes the POS program 

  

restartpc – restarts PC 

   

list – shows this list of shortcuts 

  

changepull – A slightly more advanced way of updating the POS than reload. Take longer to load. 

  

998 – Test login for the POS 

  

export + receiptnumber – sends receipts to BO again, if they haven't gone through 

  

maintainPOS.exe – updates POS to the latest version 

  

updatechart – updates the chart, if there's a problem with the turnover numbers

text: When a clerk scans an item on the pos,it shows different parametres about the product price,size and color etc. For most of the shops it is also important to see the cost price for that particular item when they scan it. It can be done by logging in to DdD admin and advanced configuration. Login to DdD admin from POS(Click on the screen with wrench icon). Go to advanced configuration Search for SHOWCOSTPRICEONITEM Change value from 0 to 1 Click on save and close. Make a reload on POS to update the changes being made. Scan an item on the POS The item information with cost price will now be visible when scanned.
title: Costprice functionality on POS
description:
When a clerk scans an item on the pos,it shows different parametres about the product price,size and color etc.

For most of the shops it is also important to see the cost price for that particular item when they scan it.

It can be done by logging in to DdD admin and advanced configuration.

Login to DdD admin from POS(Click on the screen with wrench icon).

Go to advanced configuration

Search for SHOWCOSTPRICEONITEM

Change value from 0 to 1

Click on save and close.

Make a reload on POS to update the changes being made.

Scan an item on the POS

The item information with cost price will now be visible when scanned.

text: 1. Log into the POS as usual 2. Click on the Screen-with-wrench button (This is only possible with a shop assistant who has administrator rights) 3. Choose store 4. Choose machine 5. Click Change this machine only 6. Click Customer screen 7. Replace the content in Content URL If you want to change it to a website: Insert the link If you want to change it to a picture: Insert the filepath (If you do not know how to copy the filepath of the picture follow the guide at the end of this article*) ! Attention: When inserting the filepath, remember to remove the quotation marks at the beginning and end of the filepath ! 8. Click on Save 9. Click Close 10. Click Cancel sale 11. In the Enter employee field, type restart and click the green button The POS restarts and the customer screen is now updated. If not, restart the entire PC. If this does not work either, please contact support. ____________________ *Addition to step 7: If you do not know what the filepath of the picture is follow these steps: - Open the folder where the picture is saved - Press and hold the Shift key, then right-click on the picture - Select Copy as path The filepath is now copied and can be insertet by pressing ctrl + v ! Attention: When inserting the filepath, remember to remove the quotation marks at the beginning and end of the filepath !
title: Customer screen: change picture/website
description:
1. Log into the POS as usual


2. Click on the Screen-with-wrench button (This is only possible with a shop assistant who has administrator rights)



3. Choose store


4. Choose machine


5. Click Change this machine only



6. Click Customer screen


7. Replace the content in Content URL


If you want to change it to a website: Insert the link

If you want to change it to a picture: Insert the filepath (If you do not know how to copy the filepath of the picture follow the guide at the end of this article*)

! Attention: When inserting the filepath, remember to remove the quotation marks at the beginning and end of the filepath !


8. Click on Save

9. Click Close



10. Click Cancel sale



11. In the Enter employee field, type restart and click the green button 




The POS restarts and the customer screen is now updated. If not, restart the entire PC.


If this does not work either, please contact support.





____________________






*Addition to step 7:

If you do not know what the filepath of the picture is follow these steps:

- Open the folder where the picture is saved
- Press and hold the Shift key, then right-click on the picture
- Select Copy as path


The filepath is now copied and can be insertet by pressing ctrl + v

! Attention: When inserting the filepath, remember to remove the quotation marks at the beginning and end of the filepath !

text: To deactivate the buttons (they cannot be removed completely), the login information for the loyalty club must be removed from the POS. The button called Customer cannot be shut off completely, but it is no longer possible to search for customers through that button. The Customer sign up button will no longer be available. To remove access to both buttons, log onto the pos with a user with administrator access. Log into the setup of the pos. Choose store, machine and Change this machine only Scroll down to Adv. configuration If any of the fields are grayed out, enter password ddd+2016 to unlock them. Scroll down to the DdDLoyalty setup. All these fields should be set to 0. Scroll down to the bottom of the page, click Save first and then Close. Run a reload on the POS (enter the word reload in the shop assistant field) and the buttons are now deactivated.
title: Deactivating loyalty club buttons on POS
description:
To deactivate the buttons (they cannot be removed completely), the login information for the loyalty club must be removed from the POS.

The button called Customer cannot be shut off completely, but it is no longer possible to search for customers through that button.


The Customer sign up button will no longer be available.

 

To remove access to both buttons, log onto the pos with a user with administrator access.

 

Log into the setup of the pos.


Choose store, machine and Change this machine only


Scroll down to Adv. configuration


If any of the fields are grayed out, enter password ddd+2016 to unlock them.


Scroll down to the DdDLoyalty setup. All these fields should be set to 0.

 

Scroll down to the bottom of the page, click Save first and then Close.

Run a reload on the POS (enter the word reload in the shop assistant field) and the buttons are now deactivated.

text: Installation of the New DdD POS First, we need to connect power to the DdD Pos device. You take the black power supply and connect it with the cable from the DdD Pos terminal. The flat side must faceing the same way. Then we connect the network cable. The cable comes from your Internet provider. Keyboard and Mouse are wireless and are connected to the DdD POS device with a small USB dongle as sits inside the mouse. All 5 plugs are equally good. Remember batteries and turn keyboard and mouse on. Card The terminal must also be connected to the same USB connectors from the DdD POS device. And the other end in the card terminal. Installation of K3 receipt printer. It's a slightly different plug. (RS232C) It is important, that you find the cable that says COM3 from DdD POS device. The other end is inserted into the Bon Printer. Also connect the power cable, the flat side must face down The last plug to be connected in the Printer is the cable from the Money drawer. The other end of the plug must be at the bottom of the Money drawer. If you have a K3 Label printer, it must be connected to COM2 Port, and the other end must be in the printer. There should be no other plugs in the label printer, even if they are included in the Box, apart from the Power cord. Switch on here.
title: DdD Pos Installation
description:
Installation of the New DdD POS

First, we need to connect power to the DdD Pos device. You take the black power supply and connect it with the cable from the DdD Pos terminal. The flat side must faceing the same way.



 

Then we connect the network cable. The cable comes from your Internet provider.

 

Keyboard and Mouse are wireless and are connected to the DdD POS device with a small USB dongle as sits inside the mouse. All 5 plugs are equally good. Remember batteries and turn keyboard and mouse on.

Card The terminal must also be connected to the same USB connectors from the DdD POS device.

 And the other end in the card terminal.

 

 

Installation of K3 receipt printer. It's a slightly different plug. (RS232C) It is important, that you find the cable that says COM3 from DdD POS device. The other end is inserted into the Bon Printer. Also connect the power cable, the flat side must face down

 

The last plug to be connected in the Printer is the cable from the Money drawer.

The other end of the plug must be at the bottom of the Money drawer.

 

 

If you have a K3 Label printer, it must be connected to COM2 Port, and the other end must be in the printer. There should be no other plugs in the label printer, even if they are included in the Box, apart from the Power cord.

 


 

 

 

Switch on here.

text: If you have created an item transfer on the POS and want to delete it, do this: Log into the POS, click the DdD button and choose Item Transfer Click in From this store and, if the Item Transfer is still present, select it and click Go to item transfer. Tick the Delete box and click Accept
title: Delete RIAB item transfer on POS
description:
If you have created an item transfer on the POS and want to delete it, do this:


  • Log into the POS, click the DdD button and choose Item Transfer



  • Click in From this store and, if the Item Transfer is still present, select it and click Go to item transfer.



  • Tick the Delete box and click Accept

text: Chance parameter PrintReceiptDialog to 1 and the POS will ask when ending the sale if there should be printed a receipt.
title: Don´t print receipt on sale.
description: Chance parameter PrintReceiptDialog to 1 and the POS will ask when ending the sale if there should be printed a receipt.

text: If you cannot scan a receipt, you can enter the receipt number in the barcode field with a leading R and replace the - with +. Example: You have a receipt with the number 001-01-18234 To enter the receipt manually in the POS, you have to type in R001+01+18234 and accept with the green button:
title: Enter receipt manually
description:
If you cannot scan a receipt, you can enter the receipt number in the barcode field with a leading R and replace the - with +. 

Example:

You have a receipt with the number 001-01-18234

To enter the receipt manually in the POS, you have to type in R001+01+18234 and accept with the green button:

text: 840 – Access has been restricted, the bill has most likely not been paid 2011 – Is a Nets error on DdDPos. Try restarting the POS, this can often fix the problem. Also test if the cable is connected properly in both ends. 1204 - MobilePay account has been closed. Contact Mobilepay F5 - Technical error. Retrieve card agreements and run conciliation
title: Errorcodes on POS
description:
840 –  Access has been restricted, the bill has most likely not been paid


2011 – Is a Nets error on DdDPos. Try restarting the POS, this can often fix the problem.  Also test if the cable is connected properly in both ends.

  

1204 - MobilePay account has been closed. Contact Mobilepay


F5 - Technical error. Retrieve card agreements and run conciliation

text: Log into POS with a user with Administrator rights. Change fixed date: Fixed date on the receipt, that shows the last date for exchange option. (Usually used around Christmas) Change note type: 1 = label 2 = receipt Change note variable date: How many days after purchase the customer can exchange the item
title: Exchange note setup
description:
Log into POS with a user with Administrator rights.

 

 

 

 

Change fixed date: Fixed date on the receipt, that shows the last date for exchange option. (Usually used around Christmas)

Change note type: 1 = label                                2 = receipt

Change note variable date: How many days after purchase the customer can exchange the item

text: Log into POS Click screen with wrench button Select Store and Machine Click Change this machine only Choose Currency Choose the needed currency from the dropdown box, add the exchange rate and click add, then save. Click close Click Cancel Sale Type Reload in the Sales Assistant field and click the green button.
title: Exchange rate – add on POS
description:
• Log into POS

  • Click screen with wrench button 



  • Select Store and Machine
  • Click Change this machine only




  • Choose Currency




  • Choose the needed currency from the dropdown box, add the exchange rate and click add, then save.




  • Click close




  • Click Cancel Sale




  • Type Reload in the Sales Assistant field and click the green button.

text: In some cases, it is best to disconnect the POS-PC from the power supply for 10 minutes before turning it on again. If you have an old POS-P, with a silver border around the screen, there is a cable that runs from the back of the POS-PC directly to the socket. Pull the plug out of the socket. If you have a POS-PC with a black border around the screen, there is a cable that looks like this: Either disconnect the connection shown in the picture above, or follow the cable further to the socket and pull the plug out of the socket.
title: How to disconnect the POS-PC from the power supply
description:
In some cases, it is best to disconnect the POS-PC from the power supply for 10 minutes before turning it on again.

If you have an old POS-P, with a silver border around the screen, there is a cable that runs from the back of the POS-PC  directly to the socket. Pull the plug out of the socket.

If you have a POS-PC with a black border around the screen, there is a cable that looks like this:


Either disconnect the connection shown in the picture above, or follow the cable further to the socket and pull the plug out of the socket.

text: https://www.brother.dk/support/drivers In the marked area search for your printers model name, this is usually on the front or top of the printer. Etc. Brother HL-L2310D series - Bold text is model number. Choose the model on the list. Choose your version of Windows and press "OK" On the next page choose "Complete driver package and tools (recommended " It will download the driver. Press on the installer in the download queue and installation will start. Follow the installation. After it is done the printer should start working
title: Install Brother HL printer
description:
https://www.brother.dk/support/drivers


In the marked area search for your printers model name, this is usually on the front or top of the printer.

Etc. Brother HL-L2310D series - Bold text is model number.

Choose the model on the list.


Choose your version of Windows and press "OK"



On the next page choose "Complete driver package and tools (recommended "





It will download the driver.
Press on the installer in the download queue and installation will start.




Follow the installation.
After it is done the printer should start working

text: If the item scanner does not work, follow these steps: 1. Unplug the scanner cable for 30 seconds, clean the scanner glass with a dry cloth and then plug it back in 2. Restart the computer 3. Try again to scan a product If it still does not work, try to exchange a cable if you have one available. Otherwise, contact the K3 Support.
title: Item scanner is not working
description:
If the item scanner does not work, follow these steps:

1. Unplug the scanner cable for 30 seconds, clean the scanner glass with a dry cloth and then plug it back in
2. Restart the computer
3. Try again to scan a product

If it still does not work, try to exchange a cable if you have one available. Otherwise, contact the K3 Support.

text: If you are missing a store for the item transfer, please follow these steps: 1. Log into the POS with a shop assistant that has administrations rights 2. Choose the Screen-with-Wrench button 3. Choose store, choose machine, click Change this machine only 4. Choose "Vareflytning" 5. Find the missing store under Available 6. Click the double arrow key going right and move it into the Selected box 7. Click Save 8. Click Close 9. Click Cancel sale 10. Type reload in the sales assistant field and click the green button 11. Wait for the clock to start running again and log in and retry the item transfer.
title: Item transfer - can't find shop to transfer to
description:
If you are missing a store for the item transfer, please follow these steps:


  1. 1. Log into the POS with a shop assistant that has administrations rights 


    2. Choose the Screen-with-Wrench button   

  

  1. 3. Choose store, choose machine, click Change this machine only

  

 

  

  1. 4. Choose "Vareflytning"

  

 











  1. 5. Find the missing store under Available 

  

  1. 6. Click the double arrow key going right and move it into the Selected box 

  

  1. 7. Click Save 

  

  1. 8. Click Close 

  

 

  

  1. 9. Click Cancel sale 

  

 

  

  

  1. 10. Type reload in the sales assistant field and click the green button 

  

 

  

  

  1. 11. Wait for the clock to start running again and log in and retry the item transfer.

text: In case your keyboard or mouse is not working, firstly, try a new set of batteries. If new batteries did not solve the problem, please check to see if the USB connection is still intact. If you have a wired keyboard/mouse, simply trace the cable from the device, the cable should lead to a USB port from the back of the POS, make sure its properly in place. In case your keyboard/mouse is wireless, there will still be a wireless adapter in one of the POS USB ports. Check the USB ports on the POS, and see if you can spot an adapter. It may look similar to the picture below: When you have found the adapter, make sure its plugged into the USB port properly, it might be necessary to swap to another available USB port, or to restart the system.
title: Keyboard/mouse not working
description:
In case your keyboard or mouse is not working, firstly, try a new set of batteries.



If new batteries did not solve the problem, please check to see if the USB connection is still intact. 


If you have a wired keyboard/mouse, simply trace the cable from the device, the cable should lead to a USB port from the back of the POS, make sure its properly in place. 


In case your keyboard/mouse is wireless, there will still be a wireless adapter in one of the POS USB ports. 


Check the USB ports on the POS, and see if you can spot an adapter. It may look similar to the picture below: 


When you have found the adapter, make sure its plugged into the USB port properly, it might be necessary to swap to another available USB port, or to restart the system.

text: If you experience that when you sign in to the computer and the password for login is not working. It is very important to observe the Caps Lock button on the keboard because the password is always case-sensitive. The screenshot is shared as below where you can see that caps lock button is active on keyboad. The solution in such case is to track the caps lock button on the keyboard and press it one time so the light on the button is turned off.Now try your password for login again and windows will load as normally.
title: Login to PC-POS
description:
If you experience that when you sign in to the computer and the password for login is not working.

It is very important to observe the Caps Lock button on the keboard because the password is always case-sensitive.

The screenshot is shared as below where you can see that caps lock button is active on keyboad.




The solution in such case is to track the caps lock button on the keyboard and press it one time so the light on the button is turned off.Now try your password for login again and windows will load as normally.

text: Occasionally you can be logged out of windows and will need to type a password to get to the DDD POS The standard password is: justenter
title: Password for the PC/POS
description:
Occasionally you can be logged out of windows and will need to type a password to get to the DDD POS



The standard password is: justenter

text: If you wish to hide sales numbers from customers/competitors, in case the POS screen is visible for others. Simply click on the bottom left column as shown in the picture below The entire section will then be greyed out as shown below. If you want to get the sales information shown again, click again, in the same column.
title: POS - Hide/Show sales information
description:
If you wish to hide sales numbers from customers/competitors, in case the POS screen is visible for others. Simply click on the bottom left column as shown in the picture below


The entire section will then be greyed out as shown below. If you want to get the sales information shown again, click again, in the same column.

text: Sometimes you can experience that the POS is frozen and nothing works when you want to choose an option on the POS. The clerk cannot log in to the POS program and also cannot access Back office or other menus. Other times, when trying to start the DdDPOS program, nothing happens. In all cases, you can help yourself with trying the following: Press ALT+Ctrl+ Del button at the same time on your keyboard as shown below. The window shown below appears and here you can select Task Manager If this doesn't work, click on the Windowslogo in the right corner of your screen and type: Task Manager Press Enter and the Task Manager will be opened. Then make sure to open the menu "Processes" Locate all processes starting with DDD and POS and click on End process. The POS program will close completely. Now you can try to run/start the POS program from the desktop and it should work normally again.
title: POS is stuck/frozen | DdDPOS doesn't start
description:
Sometimes you can experience that the POS is frozen and nothing works when you want to choose an option on the POS.
The clerk cannot log in to the POS program and also cannot access Back office or other menus.


Other times, when trying to start the DdDPOS program, nothing happens.

In all cases, you can help yourself with trying the following:



Press ALT+Ctrl+ Del button at the same time on your keyboard as shown below.


The window shown below appears and here you can select Task Manager



If this doesn't work, click on the Windowslogo in the right corner of your screen and type: Task Manager
Press Enter and the Task Manager will be opened.

Then make sure to open the menu "Processes"


Locate all processes starting with DDD and POS and click on End process.



The POS program will close completely.


Now you can try to run/start the POS program from the desktop and it should work normally again.

text: On the main interface of DdD POS, as shown in the below screenshot, you can see different information regarding a store. It can tell us if the POS is a RIAB POS and to which DdD server it is connected. Moreover, it also shows us the client id including terminal number for that store and which version of the POS program is currently running on the POS. Sometimes, due to internet instability in the store, the POS is not active in communication with DdD API and all data from the POS is not sent to Backoffice in that case. It is important to notice all the times, that the POS is in fact communicating with DdD server. An example is shown below where no DDDWEB with a specific number can be seen. In that case, the solution is to restart the POS programme and it can be done by simply writing RESTART in the clerk field. After restart, you will observe that the POS is now connected to the DDD webserver again.
title: POS - not communicating with DdD API/Server.
description:
On the main interface of DdD POS, as shown in the below screenshot, you can see different information regarding a store.

It can tell us if the POS is a RIAB POS and to which DdD server it is connected.

Moreover, it also shows us the client id including terminal number for that store and which version of the POS program is currently running on the POS.



Sometimes, due to internet instability in the store, the POS is not active in communication with DdD API and all data from the POS is not sent to Backoffice in that case.

It is important to notice all the times, that the POS is in fact communicating with DdD server. An example is shown below where no DDDWEB with a specific number can be seen.



In that case, the solution is to restart the POS programme and it can be done by simply writing RESTART in the clerk field.
After restart, you will observe that the POS is now connected to the DDD webserver again.

text: If the POS screen is black and there is no response from your mouse and keyboard, it is most likely turned off. First, make sure that the POS is plugged into an outlet, and that you have power. Next you need to press the On/Off button. On older POS systems, the button will be hidden underneath the screen as shown below: Looking under the screen you can see it as shown here: If you have a newer POS system, the button is easier to find, it may shine a blue light as well. Its on the bottom right side of the POS as shown below: If you have found and pressed the power button but nothing happens, please create a ticket. In case it is your only POS, call our support line.
title: POS screen is black/Turned off
description:
If the POS screen is black and there is no response from your mouse and keyboard, it is most likely turned off. 


First, make sure that the POS is plugged into an outlet, and that you have power. 


Next you need to press the On/Off button. 



On older POS systems, the button will be hidden underneath the screen as shown below:


Looking under the screen you can see it as shown here:




If you have a newer POS system, the button is easier to find, it may shine a blue light as well. Its on the bottom right side of the POS as shown below:


If you have found and pressed the power button but nothing happens, please create a ticket. In case it is your only POS, call our support line.

text: Login and press the DdD button. Here you can print a new price label or a percental label.
title: Print Discount labels on POS
description:
Login and press the DdD button. 


Here you can print a new price label or a percental label.

text: It is not possible to search for a receipt in Sweden, the search field is greyed out. Is is only possible to make one copy of the latest receipt, by pressing the Kvitt kopi button.
title: Receipt copy Sweden
description:
It is not possible to search for a receipt in Sweden, the search field is greyed out.


Is is only possible to make one copy of the latest receipt, by pressing the Kvitt kopi button.

text: If your POS looks like this: All you have to do, is to restart the POS: 1. Click on Cancel Sale 2. Type "restart" in the field where you normally type in your shop assistant number (It is important that you only use small letters when writing "restart") 3. Click on the green button 4. The POS will now be restarted. After that the red cross is no longer there.
title: Red cross in Article field
description:
If your POS looks like this:
All you have to do, is to restart the POS:

1. Click on Cancel Sale


2. Type "restart" in the field where you normally type in your shop assistant number (It is important that you only use small letters when writing "restart")

3. Click on the green button

4. The POS will now be restarted. After that the red cross is no longer there.

text: For most changes to take effect, or if something is stuck, you need to either Reload or Restart the POS if a change has been made, type in "reload" as shown below. Press the green button to do the reload. The POS is ready again for use when the clock is ticking again. Alternatively you can restart the POS by typing "restart" as shown in the picture below: This will completely shut down the POS program and reopen it.
title: Reload/restart the POS
description:
For most changes to take effect, or if something is stuck, you need to either Reload or Restart the POS


if a change has been made, type in "reload" as shown below. Press the green button to do the reload. The POS is ready again for use when the clock is ticking again.




Alternatively you can restart the POS by typing "restart" as shown in the picture below:



This will completely shut down the POS program and reopen it.

text: If a sale is not registered on the POS because of an update / error, but the sale has been registered on the card terminal, you can repeat the sale as manual payment to add the receipt to the POS without it asking for the card again. 1. Scan the items sold again/type in the ean code/search for the items. 2. Go to Payment 3. Choose Alternative Payment 4. Choose Manual Payment 5. Select which type of card was used during payment (credit/debet) 6. Click the green button. You will now have complete the sale and it will print a receipt
title: Repeat sale not registered on POS but charged on card
description:
If a sale is not registered on the POS because of an update / error, but the sale has been registered on the card terminal, you can repeat the sale as manual payment to add the receipt to the POS without it asking for the card again.


1. Scan the items sold again/type in the ean code/search for the items.


2. Go to Payment



3. Choose Alternative Payment


4. Choose Manual Payment



5. Select which type of card was used during payment (credit/debet)

6. Click the green button.




You will now have complete the sale and it will print a receipt

text: If you try to scan an item and the Enter Barcode field shows symbols instead of numbers, creating the error message that it could not find item, please check if your Caps Lock is turned on on the keyboard. Press Caps Lock once and try scanning again. If you still have the same problem, shut down the POS program by typing 999 in the Enter Employee field and 70223010 as the password. This will shut down the POS program. Now restart the PC. If this still does not fix the problem, please call Support for more help.
title: Scanner problem - symbols instead of numbers
description:
If you try to scan an item and the Enter Barcode field shows symbols instead of numbers, creating the error message that it could not find item, please check if your Caps Lock is turned on on the keyboard.



Press Caps Lock once and try scanning again.


If you still have the same problem, shut down the POS program by typing 999 in the Enter Employee field and 70223010 as the password. This will shut down the POS program.


Now restart the PC.


If this still does not fix the problem, please call Support for more help.

text: If a shop assistant needs a password, do as follows: 1. Log in as a user with administrator rights (could be the store manager if you do not have the rights) 2. Choose store, choose machine and click Change this machine only 3. Cllck on Shop assistants, add a password to the shop assistant and set the rights if they need to be changed, then click Save. You may need to run a reload/restart of the POS for it to take effect.
title: Shop assistant - add a password
description:
If a shop assistant needs a password, do as follows:


1. Log in as a user with administrator rights (could be the store manager if you do not have the rights)



2. Choose store, choose machine and click Change this machine only



3. Cllck on Shop assistants, add a password to the shop assistant and set the rights if they need to be changed, then click Save.



You may need to run a reload/restart of the POS for it to take effect.

text: Attention, if you only want to change the name assigned to a specific shop assistant number, first delete the shop assistant with this number and then create a new shop assistant with this number as described in this guide. Only shop assistants with admin rights can create new shop assistants. 1. Log into the POS and click on the Screen with wrench button. 2. Choose Store and POS and click on "Change this machine only" 3. Click Shop assistants on the left side 4. Fill in ID number (choose one that is not in use), First Name, Last Name and Password (The password can be deleted afterwards. It is only necessary to ensure the correct creation of the user.) 5. Tick Active, choose language, choose user rights and click add. 6. Scroll to the bottom and click Save. 7. Log out of the POS, Click Cancel Sale and type “reload” or “restart” (restart is best but takes the longest) in the Shop assistant field and click the green button. 8. If it doesn't work at first, wait about 10 minutes, then try again to log in with the new name.
title: Shop assistants - create new
description:
Attention, if you only want to change the name assigned to a specific shop assistant number, first delete the shop assistant with this number and then create a new shop assistant with this number as described in this guide.


Only shop assistants with admin rights can create new shop assistants.

  

  1. 1. Log into the POS and click on the Screen with wrench button. 

  

 

  

  1. 2. Choose Store and POS and click on "Change this machine only" 

  

  1. 3. Click Shop assistants on the left side 

  

  1. 4. Fill in ID number (choose one that is not in use), First Name, Last Name and Password


    (The password can be deleted afterwards. It is only necessary to ensure the correct creation of the user.)

  

  1. 5. Tick Active, choose language, choose user rights and click add.  


  2.  

  

  1. 6. Scroll to the bottom and click Save. 


  2.  

  

  1. 7. Log out of the POS, Click Cancel Sale and type “reload” or “restart” (restart is best but takes the longest)  in the Shop assistant field and click the green button. 

  


  

  1. 8. If it doesn't work at first, wait about 10 minutes, then try again to log in with the new name.

text: If your shop assistant number is not working on the POS (you can’t log in), the reason may be one of three. Your shop assistant number has, for some reason, been deactivated and must be reactivated. You are not registered on the POS and your shop assistant number must be created first. The POS program is not starting in administrator mode (only relevant if nobody can sign in) 1. Shop assistant number reactivation Sign in on the POS with an existing Shop assistant number (must have Admin access). Click on the Screen with Wrench button. Choose Store and Machine and then click Change this machine only. Click Shop assistants First check, if the shop assistant number already exists, but has been deactivated. It should have a tick in the box under Active. Tick the box, scroll to the end, click Save, then Close. Click Cancel sale, type “reload” in the Sales assistant number field and click the green button. When the clock starts running again, the Sales assistant number should work. If it still does not work, type “Restart” in Sales assistant number field and click the green button. 2. Create shop assistant number If the shop assistant number does not exist, then fill in ID, First name, Last name, Password, Active, Language and User rigths and click Add. The password can be deleted afterwards. It is only necessary to ensure the correct creation of the user. Scroll to the bottom and click Save, then Close. Click Cancel Sale and type “Reload” or “Restart” (Restart is best but takes the longest) in Sales assistant number field and click the green button. 3. POS is not starting in administrator mode Shut down the POS program by entering 999 in the Sales assistant number field and 70223010 as the password. Right-click on the POS icon on the desktop, click Properties->Shortcut->Advanced and check if there is a check mark in Run as administrator. If not, tick it, click ok and restart the POS as normal. You will get a window informing you that it is running as administrator and if you want to accept that. Click Yes. If it still doesn’t work, please create a ticket for Support and we will get back to you as fast as possible.
title: Shop assistant number does not work
description:
If your shop assistant number is not working on the POS (you can’t log in), the reason may be one of three.

  1. Your shop assistant number has, for some reason, been deactivated and must be reactivated.
  2. You are not registered on the POS and your shop assistant number must be created first.
  3. The POS program is not starting in administrator mode (only relevant if nobody can sign in)


1. Shop assistant number reactivation

  • Sign in on the POS with an existing Shop assistant number (must have Admin access).
  • Click on the Screen with Wrench button.


  • Choose Store and Machine and then click Change this machine only.




  • Click Shop assistants


 

  • First check, if the shop assistant number already exists, but has been deactivated. It should have a tick in the box under Active.



  • Tick the box, scroll to the end, click Save, then Close.



  • Click Cancel sale, type “reload” in the Sales assistant number field and click the green button.



  • When the clock starts running again, the Sales assistant number should work.
  • If it still does not work, type “Restart” in Sales assistant number field and click the green button.

 

2. Create shop assistant number

  • If the shop assistant number does not exist, then fill in ID, First name, Last name, Password, Active, Language and User rigths and click Add.

The password can be deleted afterwards. It is only necessary to ensure the correct creation of the user. 


Scroll to the bottom and click Save, then Close.


  • Click Cancel Sale and type “Reload” or “Restart” (Restart is best but takes the longest) in Sales assistant number field and click the green button.



3. POS is not starting in administrator mode


  • Shut down the POS program by entering 999 in the Sales assistant number field and 70223010 as the password.
  • Right-click on the POS icon on the desktop, click Properties->Shortcut->Advanced and check if there is a check mark in Run as administrator. 
  • If not, tick it, click ok and restart the POS as normal. 
  • You will get a window informing you that it is running as administrator and if you want to accept that. Click Yes.



  • If it still doesn’t work, please create a ticket for Support and we will get back to you as fast as possible.

text: When you log into the POS and scan an item and get an error message similar to the one below, most of the time, you can fix it yourself. 1. Click on the error message to turn it off. 2. Log into the POS as usual 3. Click on the Screen-with-wrench button (This is only possible with a shop assistant who has administrator rights) 4. Choose store 5. Choose machine 6. Click Change this machine only 7. Click Search parameters 8. Click and hold the left mouse button on a search parameter under the black line and pull it above the black line. 9. Click Save and repeat the process, only the other way around (pull the search parameter you just pulled above the black line, below the black line again). 10. Click Save again. 11. Click Close 12. Click Cancel sale 13. In the Enter employee field, type RELOAD and click the green button The POS Program will restart and this should remove the StartIndex Error. If this is not the case, then please call Support.
title: StartIndex Error
description:
When you log into the POS and scan an item and get an error message similar to the one below, most of the time, you can fix it yourself.


1. Click on the error message to turn it off.


2. Log into the POS as usual


3. Click on the Screen-with-wrench button (This is only possible with a shop assistant who has administrator rights)



4. Choose store


5. Choose machine


6. Click Change this machine only



7. Click Search parameters



8. Click and hold the left mouse button on a search parameter under the black line and pull it above the black line. 



9. Click Save and repeat the process, only the other way around (pull the search parameter you just pulled above the black line, below the black line again).


10. Click Save again.


11. Click Close



12. Click Cancel sale



13. In the Enter employee field, type RELOAD and click the green button



The POS Program will restart and this should remove the StartIndex Error.


If this is not the case, then please call Support.

text: ATTENTION!!! Make certain that Windows is always updated and that the PC is shut down once a week. ATTENTION!!! Be aware that we do not support Acrobat REader or Foxit PDF Reader. Acrobat Reader Windows 7 1. Repair Acrobat Reader 2. Does this not work, then uninstall the old app. Get the latest version from the Adobe website https://get.adobe.com/reader/otherversions/ Install the new app. Test if the program works (either by opening a pdf or just opening the program) 3. If that does not work, try installing Foxit PDF Reader instead. https://www.foxit.com/pdf-reader/ Install the app Test it 4. If that doesn't work either, it is possible that you may need a new POS. Please contact support for further help. Acrobat Reader Windows 10/11 1. Repair Adobe Acrobat Reader 2. If the repair does not work, uninstall the program and reinstall it Get the latest version from Adobe's website https://get.adobe.com/reader/ Install the new app Test it 3. If it still doesn't work, try installing Foxit PDF Reader instead. https://www.foxit.com/pdf-reader/ 4. If that does not work either, you may need a new pos or a reinstall of Windows. Please contact Support for further help.
title: Update / reinstall / uninstall Acrobat Reader Windows 7 & 10
description:
ATTENTION!!! Make certain that Windows is always updated and that the PC is shut down once a week.

ATTENTION!!! Be aware that we do not support Acrobat REader or Foxit PDF Reader.

 

Acrobat Reader Windows 7

 

1. Repair Acrobat Reader

 

 

 

 

 

 

2. Does this not work, then uninstall the old app.

 

 

Get the latest version from the Adobe website

https://get.adobe.com/reader/otherversions/

Install the new app.

Test if the program works (either by opening a pdf or just opening the program)

3. If that does not work, try installing Foxit PDF Reader instead.

https://www.foxit.com/pdf-reader/

Install the app

Test it

4. If that doesn't work either, it is possible that you may need a new POS. Please contact support for further help.

 

 

Acrobat Reader Windows 10/11

 

1. Repair Adobe Acrobat Reader

 

 

 

 

 

2. If the repair does not work, uninstall the program and reinstall it

 


Get the latest version from Adobe's website

https://get.adobe.com/reader/


Install the new app

Test it

 

3. If it  still doesn't work, try installing Foxit PDF Reader instead.

https://www.foxit.com/pdf-reader/

 

4. If that does not work either, you may need a new pos or a reinstall of Windows. Please contact Support for further help.

text: A common practice is when any device does not perform well as it is expected,may be It just needs a restart. Sometime a simple restart to the POS also solves the problem. We also recommend that POS needs to be restarted at least once in a week. You can restart pc from windows as well as from POS program. From Windows: Click on Windows/start button then Power and select restart From POS programme: Just write restartpc in clerk field.
title: POS does not work-Just restart it
description:
A common practice is when any device does not perform well as it is expected,may be It just needs a restart.

Sometime a simple restart to the POS also solves the problem.

We also recommend that POS needs to be restarted at least once in a week.


You can restart pc from windows as well as from POS program.

From Windows:
Click on Windows/start button then Power and select restart




From POS programme:


Just write restartpc in clerk field.

text: We no longer support MobilePay, and therefore the button has been deactivated. You can still use MobilePay and you can also still make it appear on the receipt. You just have to conclude the payment slightly differently. Have the customer use the QR Code to pay. To add the payment to the receipt, follow the below steps: 1. Click Go To Payment 2. Choose Alternative payment 3. Choose Manual payment 4. Choose Mobile Payment 5. Click the green button
title: MobilePay button is not working any more
description:
We no longer support MobilePay, and therefore the button has been deactivated.


You can still use MobilePay and you can also still make it appear on the receipt. You just have to conclude the payment slightly differently.


Have the customer use the QR Code to pay.


To add the payment to the receipt, follow the below steps:


1. Click Go To Payment


2. Choose Alternative payment


3. Choose Manual payment



4. Choose Mobile Payment


5. Click the green button

text: On DdD POS, If a store wants to transfer some items to their other stores at different locations,it can be done as follows. First,scan all those items that needs to be moved. When all the items are scanned,then go to payment options as shown with number box number 2. Then by selecting other payments method and then select vareflytning-->item movement. Then select the desired store,where the items need to be transferred and approve it with big green button. The store will also receive a receipt from the receipt printer after confirmation.The receipt has information which item has been transferred to which store.
title: Item movement on POS
description:
On DdD POS, If a store wants to transfer some items to their other stores at different locations,it can be done as follows.

First,scan all those items that needs to be moved.

When all the items are scanned,then go to payment options as shown with number box number 2.



Then by selecting other payments method and then select vareflytning-->item movement.
Then select the desired store,where the items need to be transferred and approve it with big green button.

The store will also receive a receipt from the receipt printer after confirmation.The receipt has information which item has been transferred to which store.

text: If the POS or card terminal ask for new card agreements follow this guide. Log in to the POS Choose Shortcuts and then configure terminal. In the new windows press Download card agreements. Afterwards a small windows will open, wait for it to finish and print out a receipt.
title: Cardterminal - New card agreements
description:
If the POS or card terminal ask for new card agreements follow this guide.


Log in to the POS
Choose Shortcuts and then configure terminal.



In the new windows press Download card agreements.
Afterwards a small windows will open, wait for it to finish and print out a receipt.

text: How to check if a giftcard / voucher has been used or is still open: Sign into the POS 1. Select Shortcuts 2. Select Reports 1. Enter From and To date 2. Choose if you want to view the report on the screen or have it printed on the receiptprinter. 3. Choose either Giftcards or Vouchers (Creditnotes).
title: Open giftcards / vouchers on POS
description:
How to check if a giftcard / voucher has been used or is still open:


Sign into the POS


1. Select Shortcuts


2. Select Reports



1. Enter From and To date


2. Choose if you want to view the report on the screen or have it printed on the receiptprinter.


3. Choose either Giftcards or Vouchers (Creditnotes).

text: If the cash register looks like this, it helps to close the programme via the task manager. You can find instructions on how to do this here: POS is stuck/frozen
title: Error "Cannot acces a disposed object. Object name: 'URLScreen'.
description: If the cash register looks like this, it helps to close the programme via the task manager. You can find instructions on how to do this here: POS is stuck/frozen

text: If you for one reason or another have not been able to print the end of day receipt on your receipt printer, this can be repeated by following these steps: Log into your POS Click Shortcuts (1) Click Search Note (2) Choose Date Interval (1) Set Starte date (2) and End date (3) Click Search (4) Locate the last Note of the start date and the first note of the end date. There will be a Note number missing between the two (in this example it would be 154). Change search method to Enter note number (6) Enter the note number (1) Click the green button (2) You can now reprint the missing note.
title: Reprint End of Day receipt on POS
description:
If you for one reason or another have not been able to print the end of day receipt on your receipt printer, this can be repeated by following these steps:


Log into your POS


Click Shortcuts (1)


Click Search Note (2)



Choose Date Interval (1)


Set Starte date (2) and End date (3)


Click Search (4)


Locate the last Note of the start date and the first note of the end date. There will be a Note number missing between the two (in this example it would be 154).


Change search method to Enter note number (6)



Enter the note number (1)


Click the green button (2)



You can now reprint the missing note.

text: To access the demo mode on the POS, you need to enter 998 as sales assistant number. The demo mode can be used to test various scenarios without it affecting the sales numbers.
title: Demo-mode on POS
description:
To access the demo mode on the POS, you need to enter 998 as sales assistant number.


The demo mode can be used to test various scenarios without it affecting the sales numbers.

text: In some cases, if the receipt printer is not printing barcodes clearly enough, you can access receipts without scanning them in the following way. First you need to find the receipt number. You can either see this on the receipt itself or find it on the POS by looking up old receipts. Log into the POS with your sales clerk number. Go to Shortcuts -> Search Note Locate the receipt in question. Change to Date interval -> insert start date and end date -> locate the receipt in question -> make a note of the full number -> click close Now enter the number in the barcode field preceeded by an R and replace the - with a +. Press Enter and the receipt will open.
title: How to open a receipt manually if you cannot scan it
description:
In some cases, if the receipt printer is not printing barcodes clearly enough, you can access receipts without scanning them in the following way.


First you need to find the receipt number. You can either see this on the receipt itself or find it on the POS by looking up old receipts.


Log into the POS with your sales clerk number.


Go to Shortcuts -> Search Note



Locate the receipt in question.


Change to Date interval -> insert start date and end date -> locate the receipt in question -> make a note of the full number -> click close



Now enter the number in the barcode field preceeded by an R and replace the - with a +.


Press Enter and the receipt will open.

text: If you accidentally have created an expense on the pos or you made a mistake when creating it, you can return it like you return any item by clicking on Note Correction under Functions etc., scanning the barcode on the receipt/note and clicking the green button.
title: Expense - can it be returned?
description: If you accidentally have created an expense on the pos or you made a mistake when creating it, you can return it like you return any item by clicking on Note Correction under Functions etc., scanning the barcode on the receipt/note and clicking the green button.

text: Since it is not legal in Denmark to accept cash payments exceeding 14,999 DKK, we have implemented a lock that prevents transactions above this amount. This restriction is only enabled for Danish stores. However, if a store requests to disable this function, you can set the parameter "CheckForCashMaxAmount" to 0 in the Advanced Configuration section of DdDAdmin. I recommend that we receive such requests from stores in writing for documentation purposes.
title: Max Cash Amount
description:
Since it is not legal in Denmark to accept cash payments exceeding 14,999 DKK, we have implemented a lock that prevents transactions above this amount.


This restriction is only enabled for Danish stores.


However, if a store requests to disable this function, you can set the parameter "CheckForCashMaxAmount" to 0 in the Advanced Configuration section of DdDAdmin.


I recommend that we receive such requests from stores in writing for documentation purposes.

text: To prevent clerks from mistakenly adding an excessively high amount to the till, we have introduced a function in DdDAdmin: "CheckForMaxAmount" "MaxAmount" By default, CheckForMaxAmount is enabled, and the MaxAmount for Scandinavian stores is set to 20,000 DKK.
title: Max Amount
description:
To prevent clerks from mistakenly adding an excessively high amount to the till, we have introduced a function in DdDAdmin:

  • "CheckForMaxAmount"
  • "MaxAmount"


By default, CheckForMaxAmount is enabled, and the MaxAmount for Scandinavian stores is set to 20,000 DKK.

text: To change the name of a product line, follow this guide. Log into Backoffice 1. Click Maintenance 2. Click Product lines 3. Search for or scroll down to the product line you want to change 4. Click on it 5. Change the Decription 6. Change the POS text (this is what you will see on the POS) 7. Click Save Run Reload or Restart on the POS to get it to update.

text: If your card terminal cant do any transactions and the screen is blank, you most likely need to reboot it Simply Press and hold the yellow button (Clear) and the Comma button both at the same time for a few seconds. The card terminal will now reboot and should be operational again within 30 seconds.
title: Card terminal stuck (blank screen)
description:
If your card terminal cant do any transactions and the screen is blank, you most likely need to reboot it




Simply Press and hold the yellow button (Clear) and the Comma button both at the same time for a few seconds. The card terminal will now reboot and should be operational again within 30 seconds.

text: Change Langues in a PET terminal You need to have the Merchant Card Ready or the Merchant code ready. You need to get into the Merchant menu. Swipe the Merchant card or press menu and 8, get you in to the same menu. Press the red key ones, to enter the Merchant code. Press 6 follow by 1 to change the setting. Press then 6 to select a new profile. You need to use the Arrows to step down. Press the Green botten. The terminal will Reboot.
title: Change Language on the PET Terminal
description:
Change Langues in a PET terminal

 

You need to have the Merchant Card Ready or the Merchant code ready.

You need to get into the Merchant menu. Swipe the Merchant card or press menu and 8,  get you in to the same menu. Press the red key ones, to enter the Merchant code.

 

Press 6 follow by 1 to change the setting.

 

       

 

 

Press then 6 to select a new profile. You need to use the Arrows to step down. Press the Green botten.

The terminal will Reboot.

text: After the cable at the back of the card terminal has been switched over to the new terminal and it is up and running, you just need to download card Agreements from Nets. This is done in the following way. Open the checkout and log in, as you do when you have to make a sale. Select the shortcut Genveje Press the button at the bottom right "Configure Terminal" Press "Download Card Agreements" (the Card terminal starts a window and communicates with Nets) Press there after "Afstemning" a new window will appear and the whole thing takes a maximum of 2 minutes. Then the card terminal is ready.
title: Guidance on switching to a new Card terminal
description:
After the cable at the back of the card terminal has been switched over to the new terminal and it is up and running, you just need to download card Agreements from Nets.


This is done in the following way.

Open the checkout and log in, as you do when you have to make a sale.

Select the shortcut Genveje


 

 

 

Press the button at the bottom right "Configure Terminal"

 

Press "Download Card Agreements" (the Card terminal starts a window and communicates with Nets)

Press there after "Afstemning" a new window will appear and the whole thing takes a maximum of 2 minutes.



Then the card terminal is ready.

text: On the newest POS models, the customer facing screen will have to be attached after having been unboxed. Luckily this is a simple task. On the back of the POS you can see a grey metal plate with 2 dents, this is were you will attach the customer facing screen. shown below is the backside of the customer screen, you can see the 2 metal studs. Simply lower the studs onto the 2 dents on the backside of the POS, it will slide in place. Note that it is fairly secure once in place, but you should still carry the device carefully if you need to move it. The customer screen has a single cable that it needs to be plugged into, cable is shown below: As shown below, the customer screen only has 1 port, this is where the cable goes. On the POS itself, the cable goes to the port thats similar to the one on the customer screen, it is highlighted below: Once the cable is plugged in, and the customer screen attached, the POS and customer screen are assembled and ready for use.
title: NEW POS - Attaching customer screen
description:
On the newest POS models, the customer facing screen will have to be attached after having been unboxed.

Luckily this is a simple task. 


On the back of the POS you can see a grey metal plate with 2 dents, this is were you will attach the customer facing screen. 

shown below is the backside of the customer screen, you can see the 2 metal studs. Simply lower the studs onto the 2 dents on the backside of the POS, it will slide in place.  Note that it is fairly secure once in place, but you should still carry the device carefully if you need to move it.


The customer screen has a single cable that it needs to be plugged into, cable is shown below: 


As shown below, the customer screen only has 1 port, this is where the cable goes.


On the POS itself, the cable goes to the port thats similar to the one on the customer screen, it is highlighted below: 



Once the cable is plugged in, and the customer screen attached, the POS and customer screen are assembled and ready for use.

text: If the sales clerks have not done the evening balance the evening before, the POS will ask if this should be done when they open the POS the next morning. If the clerk says no and conducts a sale, it cannot be done later. The evening balance will then have to be done like always in the evening, and both days will be added to the turnover.
title: Evening balance - following day
description:
If the sales clerks have not done the evening balance the evening before, the POS will ask if this should be done when they open the POS the next morning. 

  

If the clerk says no and conducts a sale, it cannot be done later. The evening balance will then have to be done like always in the evening, and both days will be added to the turnover.

text: If the receipt for the evening balance (the one with the overview from the card terminal etc.) is missing, then search for receipt, find the last receipt number, then look for a receipt with the number immediately after that and print it. 1. On the POS, click Shortcuts, then Search Note 2. Choose Date interval, then Start Date and End Date. Observe the number of the last receipt. 3. Choose Enter receipt number 4. Enter the number that is next in line and click search 5. Click Reprint to print the receipt again.
title: Evening balance - receipt
description:
If the receipt for the evening balance (the one with the overview from the card terminal etc.) is missing, then search for receipt, find the last receipt number, then look for a receipt with the number immediately after that and print it. 

  

1. On the POS, click Shortcuts, then Search Note 

2. Choose

 Date interval, then Start Date and End Date. Observe the number of the last receipt.

 


3. Choose

 Enter receipt number

 

4. Enter the number that is next in line and click search

 

5. Click

 Reprint to print the receipt again.

text: There are 3 steps in total to perform a cash statement. The clerk needs to record how much money is currently in the kasse and how much he should deposit in the bank. The money taken out in cash from the kasse needs to be registered in kasse report. The steps are as follows. The clerk needs to login to POS. Select Genvej and then click on Kasseopgørelse. Step 1 The clerk needs to enter the amount that is currently available(aftenbeholdning) in the kasse.In the example it is assumed that there are 20 Dkk now and click Næste/Next. Step 2: The next step is with how much cash money needs to be taken out of the kasse and should be deposited in the bank. In this case,the amount needs to be taken out for bank deposit is 50 DKK and click Next. Step 3: The final step justifies if all information entered by Clerk is correct and after confirmation the approved button is pressed and the cash statement is activated on the Kasse.
title: How to do Cash Statement/Kasseopgørelse
description:
There are 3 steps in total to perform a cash statement.
The clerk needs to record how much money is currently in the kasse and how much he should deposit in the bank.
The money taken out in cash from the kasse needs to be registered in kasse report.

The steps are as follows.

The clerk needs to login to POS.
Select Genvej and then click on Kasseopgørelse.



Step 1
The clerk needs to enter the amount that is currently available(aftenbeholdning) in the kasse.In the example it is assumed that there are 20 Dkk now and click Næste/Next.



Step 2:

The next step is with how much cash money needs to be taken out of the kasse and should be deposited in the bank.
In this case,the amount needs to be taken out for bank deposit is 50 DKK and click Next.


Step 3:

The final step justifies if all information entered by Clerk is correct and after confirmation the approved button is pressed and the cash statement is activated on the Kasse.

text: Changing the language of the scanner is done in a few steps. The number and selection of languages you can choose from on the scanner depends on how/where its set up. Make sure the scanner is turned off. Now hold the power button and number 8 at the same time for a couple of seconds. Press the number 2 button, "activate" for the language selection Press the number from the line with the language you wish for (In this case, 1 for DK, 2 for UK, 3 for DE. Please be aware of that some scanners only have 2 or 1 language to choose from) Alternatively navigate using the arrows, move the highlight to the preferred language and then select that language by pressing the top left button You will now get this screen on the scanner. If its a scanner you just received and have not used. Press the "ESC" button to clear memory from possible earlier use. If its a scanner you are already using, just wait a few seconds and you will be taken to the start menu.
title: Changing the language on the scanner
description:
Changing the language of the scanner is done in a few steps. The number and selection of languages you can choose from on the scanner depends on how/where its set up.



Make sure the scanner is turned off. Now hold the power button and number 8 at the same time for a couple of seconds.


Press the number 2 button, "activate" for the language selection


Press the number from the line with the language you wish for (In this case, 1 for DK, 2 for UK, 3 for DE. Please be aware of that some scanners only have 2 or 1 language to choose from)


Alternatively navigate using the arrows, move the highlight to the preferred language and then select that language by pressing the top left button 

You will now get this screen on the scanner. If its a scanner you just received and have not used. Press the "ESC" button to clear memory from possible earlier use. If its a scanner you are already using, just wait a few seconds and you will be taken to the start menu.
