1. Click on Maintenance

2. Click on New Master Logon

text: If you have yellow (or red) exclamation marks in Backoffice on Label, Printout and SysInfo and can neither retrieve or print reports or print lables, your SaClient might be defective and either needs to be reinstalled or just fixed. Backoffice will ask you to reinstall SaClient. If you do this repeatedly and it still does not work, then reinstalling it is not the problem. Instead, you need to run the attached program (FixSaClient.bat) to correct whatever problem SaClient is experiencing. Download the program onto your desktop and run it. You may need to run it as Administrator (right-click on the program and choose Run as administrator).* Click Y to the question asked (only necessary if you run the program as an administrator. Otherwise, it will just run and shut down the below window again within seconds.) It is a good idea to briefly turn off the printer and turn it on again and refresh the browser window. If refreshing the window does not work, briefly log out and log in again in Backoffice. If you are still experiencing problems, please raise a ticket through our Support Portal and we will contact you. ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ *In some cases, this window appears after you have clicked "Run as administrator". Click More Info Click Run anyway In some cases, this information is displayed where the administrator login data must be entered. If you do not know these, ask your IT administrator to enter them.
title: Exclamation marks in Backoffice / Can't retrieve reports and/or print labels
description:
If you have yellow (or red) exclamation marks in Backoffice on Label, Printout and SysInfo and can neither retrieve or print reports or print lables, your SaClient might be defective and either needs to be reinstalled or just fixed.




Backoffice will ask you to reinstall SaClient. If you do this repeatedly and it still does not work, then reinstalling it is not the problem. Instead, you need to run the attached program (FixSaClient.bat) to correct whatever problem SaClient is experiencing.


Download the program onto your desktop and run it.



You may need to run it as Administrator (right-click on the program and choose Run as administrator).*



Click Y to the question asked (only necessary if you run the program as an administrator. Otherwise, it will just run and shut down the below window again within seconds.)



It is a good idea to briefly turn off the printer and turn it on again and refresh the browser window.



If refreshing the window does not work, briefly log out and log in again in Backoffice.


If you are still experiencing problems, please raise a ticket through our Support Portal and we will contact you.


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________





*In some cases, this window appears after you have clicked "Run as administrator". Click More Info

 

 

Click Run anyway

 





In some cases, this information is displayed where the administrator login data must be entered. If you do not know these, ask your IT administrator to enter them.

text: DdD Back Office is accessible on all Windows computers with Google Chrome browser. 1. Open DdD Back Office in Google Chrome Open Google Chrome and paste the following link into the address bar and confirm with Enter: DdDbackoffice.com 2. Enter your log-in data If you do not know them, you can request them by e-mail. You can find instructions here: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data After you have entered your Client-ID and Client-CODE, you must select a machine. It is important that you select a machine that is not in use on any other PC. If all machines are already in use on other computers, please send a ticket to Support with a request to create a new Back Office machine. Please also let us know what the machine should be called and what the password should be. 3. Install SAClient After you have successfully logged in, you will be asked to install SAClient. You can find instructions for this here: Install SAClient
title: Back Office on another computer
description:
DdD Back Office is accessible on all Windows computers with Google Chrome browser.


1. Open DdD Back Office in Google Chrome

Open Google Chrome and paste the following link into the address bar and confirm with Enter: DdDbackoffice.com


2. Enter your log-in data

If you do not know them, you can request them by e-mail. You can find instructions here: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data


After you have entered your Client-ID and Client-CODE, you must select a machine. It is important that you select a machine that is not in use on any other PC. If all machines are already in use on other computers, please send a ticket to Support with a request to create a new Back Office machine. Please also let us know what the machine should be called and what the password should be.



3. Install SAClient

After you have successfully logged in, you will be asked to install SAClient. You can find instructions for this here: Install SAClient

text: Are you in doubt about whether all receipts/notes have been transfered to Backoffice (if e.g. there is a difference in Finance Report you can't explain), you can start with ordering a transaction report (either in Backoffice or on the POS). The receipt/note numbers have to be continuous per store with the one exception of the cash balance note (if this is done at the end of day), which is not shown on the list (see the below example, where receipt/note number 48296 is not shown in the report at the end of the day, because it is the cash balance). When you have gone through the report and found missing transactions, you can transfer them yourself if there aren't that many of them. You can only transfer one at a time if you do it yourself. If it is a question of many, then please create a ticket on our portal, citing whic receipte/note numbers are missing (attach the report) and the case will be forwarded to our development team. If it is a matter of a few receipts/notes, open the POS and in the shop assistant field type "export XXXXX" and click the green button as in the example below. The missing receipt/note will now be transfered to Backoffice. The POS will not acknowledge the transfer in any way and you will have to be a little patient, as the transfer speed depends on how busy the system is. After half an hour / an hour you can order a new transaction list to check if the receipts/notes hae turned up.
title: Missing receipts/notes in Backoffice
description:
Are you in doubt about whether all receipts/notes have been transfered to Backoffice (if e.g. there is a difference in Finance Report you can't explain), you can start with ordering a transaction report (either in Backoffice or on the POS).

The receipt/note numbers have to be continuous per store with the one exception of the cash balance note (if this is done at the end of day), which is not shown on the list (see the below example, where receipt/note number 48296 is not shown in the report at the end of the day, because it is the cash balance). 

 

 

When you have gone through the report and found missing transactions, you can transfer them yourself if there aren't that many of them. You can only transfer one at a time if you do it yourself. If it is a question of many, then please create a ticket on our portal, citing whic receipte/note numbers are missing (attach the report) and the case will be forwarded to our development team.

If it is a matter of a few receipts/notes, open the POS and in the shop assistant field type "export XXXXX" and click the green button as in the example below.

 

The missing receipt/note will now be transfered to Backoffice. The POS will not acknowledge the transfer in any way and you will have to be a little patient, as the transfer speed depends on how busy the system is.

 After half an hour / an hour you can order a new transaction list to check if the receipts/notes hae turned up.

text: Exchange rates in Backoffice: You created Exchange rates in Backoffice like this: Exchange rate equals British Pounds (or Danish Kronor. The first line is always fixed to the currency of the shop) compared to e.g. Dollars or Euro. Exchange rate EURO equals if you have 100 Euro and what that is worth in British Pounds. Exsample Exchange rate GDP 100 = EUR 68,91 Kurs EURO Euro 100 = GDP 84,06 The exchange rates are set to today's date. If you want to set an approximate date and stick to that or you want to manually change the exchange rate whenever it changes is up to you Suppliers with Euro prices: Attention!!! You have to create Euro under Currencies before you can use it under Suppliers. If you have a supplier, who uses EURO instead of British Pounds, you can create another version using EURO. Exsample Supplier Lenette (already exists and has been created with British Pounds as Currency. You cannot change the currency on an existing supplier) You then create a new supplier (called e.g. Lenette EURO) with the same information, except for changing the Currency to EURO. If it is a new supplier who only uses EURO, you just create them as a new supplier with EURO as currency.
title: Exchange rates in DdD Backoffice
description:
Exchange rates in Backoffice:

You created Exchange rates in Backoffice like this:


Exchange rate equals British Pounds (or Danish Kronor. The first line is always fixed to the currency of the shop) compared to e.g. Dollars or Euro. 

Exchange rate EURO equals if you have 100 Euro and what that is worth in British Pounds.

Exsample

Exchange rate
GDP 100 = EUR 68,91

Kurs EURO
Euro 100 = GDP 84,06

The exchange rates are set to today's date. If you want to set an approximate date and stick to that or you want to manually change the exchange rate whenever it changes is up to you



Suppliers with Euro prices:

Attention!!! You have to create Euro under Currencies before you can use it under Suppliers.

If you have a supplier, who uses EURO instead of British Pounds, you can create another version using EURO.

Exsample

Supplier Lenette (already exists and has been created with British Pounds as Currency. You cannot change the currency on an existing supplier)

You then create a new supplier (called e.g. Lenette EURO) with the same information, except for changing the Currency to EURO.

 
If it is a new supplier who only uses EURO, you just create them as a new supplier with EURO as currency.

text: If you have had issues with adding an article and have decided to remove it and add it again, but you cannot delete it because the article has had transactions already (adding items to stock counts as a transaction in Backoffice) you have to remember to remove the EAN code from the old article or this is what the POS will show when the barcode is scanned on the POS. To prevent this, remove the EAN code from the old article. Open the new article, delete the EAN code, save it, add the EAN code again, save it and then run a CHANGEPULL on the POS. That will fix the issue with the POS showing the old article without text etc.
title: Barcode of newly added article replacing old article brings up old article
description:
If you have had issues with adding an article and have decided to remove it and add it again, but you cannot delete it because the article has had transactions already (adding items to stock counts as a transaction in Backoffice) you have to remember to remove the EAN code from the old article or this is what the POS will show when the barcode is scanned on the POS.


To prevent this, remove the EAN code from the old article.


Open the new article, delete the EAN code, save it, add the EAN code again, save it and then run a CHANGEPULL on the POS.


That will fix the issue with the POS showing the old article without text etc.

text: If the print from your label printer is unclear, it often helps to clean the label printer. To ensure good print quality and to extend the lifetime of the printer, it is very important to clean the printer regularly (ideally at each roll change). The manufacturer recommends using the "Head Cleaner" supplied with the printer and a cotton swab. If you no longer have this, you can also use a dry cloth.
title: Citizen: Cleaning of the Label Printer
description:
If the print from your label printer is unclear, it often helps to clean the label printer.
 

To ensure good print quality and to extend the lifetime of the printer, it is very important to clean the printer regularly (ideally at each roll change).


The manufacturer recommends using the "Head Cleaner" supplied with the printer and a cotton swab. If you no longer have this, you can also use a dry cloth.

text: If the printer does not print correctly (for example, it keeps printing empty labels in between), please check the following 2 things: 1. Is the printer clean? You can read how to clean the printer in the article Cleaning of the label printer. 2. Are the blue wheels in the printer set correctly? Open the printer and set the small blue wheel (media thickness) to 0 and the bigger blue wheel (media width) to 9. If that does not help, please disconnect the printer from the power supply for 30 seconds and then reconnect it.
title: Citizen: Print is too faint / wrong adjustment
description:
If the printer does not print correctly (for example, it keeps printing empty labels in between), please check the following 2 things:

1. Is the printer clean? You can read how to clean the printer in the article Cleaning of the label printer.


2. Are the blue wheels in the printer set correctly? Open the printer and set the small blue wheel (media thickness) to 0 and the bigger blue wheel (media width) to 9.




If that does not help, please disconnect the printer from the power supply for 30 seconds and then reconnect it.

text: If the light on the label printer isn't turning on, and nothing happens when you press the FEED button, try these steps: 1. Disconnect the printer from the power for 30 seconds. 2. Check if the power cord is plugged into the wall outlet correctly. 3. Make sure the power cord is properly connected to the printer. 4. Test the wall outlet by plugging in another working appliance. 5. Is the power cord damaged? Try using a new power cord.
title: Label printer is not working at all
description:
If the light on the label printer isn't turning on, and nothing happens when you press the FEED button, try these steps:


1. Disconnect the printer from the power for 30 seconds.


2. Check if the power cord is plugged into the wall outlet correctly.


3. Make sure the power cord is properly connected to the printer.


4. Test the wall outlet by plugging in another working appliance.


5. Is the power cord damaged? Try using a new power cord.

text: In this table you can see what the various error light messages mean:
title: Label printer error lights
description: In this table you can see what the various error light messages mean:

text: If a label printer is regularly printing blank labels in between actual labels, it is most likely related to the label sensor found as shown in the picture below: Clean the sensor, and also make sure that the triangle and line as aligned as shown below:
title: Blank labels in between actual labels
description:
If a label printer is regularly printing blank labels in between actual labels, it is most likely related to the label sensor found as shown in the picture below: 



Clean the sensor, and also make sure that the triangle and line as aligned as shown below:

text: Open File Explorer: Click the File Explorer icon on the taskbar, or press Windows + E to open it. Select 'This PC': On the left side, click on This PC. Click on 'Add a network location': At the top of the window, click on the Computer tab and then on Add a network location in the toolbar. The 'Add Network Location' wizard starts: Click Next to start the wizard. Select Choose a custom network location and click Next. Enter the network location: Internet or network address: (ftp://ftp01.dddretail.com/) for the folder you want to add as a network location. Click Next. Name the location: You can give the network location a name for easy recognition. Then click Next. Complete the setup: Click Finish to complete the setup. The network location will now be visible under This PC. When you log in for the first time, you can ask Windows to save the password for direct access to the folder.
title: Add networks location
description:
• Open File Explorer:
  • Click the File Explorer icon on the taskbar, or press Windows + E to open it.
  • Select 'This PC':
  • On the left side, click on This PC.
  • Click on 'Add a network location':
  • At the top of the window, click on the Computer tab and then on Add a network location in the toolbar.
  • The 'Add Network Location' wizard starts:
  • Click Next to start the wizard.
  • Select Choose a custom network location and click Next.
  • Enter the network location:
    Internet or network address: (ftp://ftp01.dddretail.com/) for the folder you want to add as a network location.
  • Click Next.
  • Name the location:
    You can give the network location a name for easy recognition. Then click Next.
  • Complete the setup:
  • Click Finish to complete the setup. The network location will now be visible under This PC.
  • When you log in for the first time, you can ask Windows to save the password for direct access to the folder.

text: Some times the customer purchases from a shop but the receipt/amount is not registered in DdD loyalty and the customer cannot receive his bonus points/Money. The customer comes back and want to register his purchase in order to activate his bonus and receive the points he deserves. It can also be done by the shop clerk if they have access to DdD loyalty. First of all the clerk needs to login from the following link by entering login details. By logging in,Locate the customer by its name or customer number Here,the example is taken for a customer named Thomas with customer number 204640411 Then the clerk must enter information for the receipt. When the following information is entered the receipt is read and the points are added accordingly to the customer. As soon as the blue button is clicked ,the receipt is read by the system as shown with 699 danish kroner and is assigned to the customer by clicking save button in the window. Now we can see that the receipt number 734 has been assigned to the customer and the bonus points are accordingly activated for this particular purchase.
title: Assigning a recipt/purchase to a customer in DdD loyalty
description:
Some times the customer purchases from a shop but the receipt/amount is not registered in DdD loyalty and the customer cannot receive his bonus points/Money.
The customer comes back and want to register his purchase in order to activate his bonus and receive the points he deserves.

It can also be done by the shop clerk if they have access to DdD loyalty.

First of all the clerk needs to login from the following link by entering login details.
 

By logging in,Locate the customer by its name or customer number

Here,the example is taken for a customer named Thomas with customer number 204640411



Then the clerk must enter information for the receipt.



When the following information is entered the receipt is read and the points are added accordingly to the customer.


As soon as the blue button is clicked ,the receipt is read by the system as shown with 699  danish kroner

and is assigned to the customer by clicking save button in the window.




Now we can see that the receipt number 734 has been assigned to the customer and the bonus points are accordingly activated for this particular purchase.

text: It is now possible to export a list with all your members. Just log in to you Loyalty Portal and press export Members. Login with your credentials: Choose the group you want to access. (In case there are more then one) Choose Export members. The file you download, will be a CSV file, that can be imported into Excel.
title: Export members
description:
It is now possible to export a list with all your members. Just log in to you Loyalty Portal and press export Members. 


Login with your credentials:


Choose the group you want to access. (In case there are more then one)


Choose Export members. 



The file you download, will be a CSV file, that can be imported into Excel.

text: Hi An integration between DdD and Economic has been ordered. To be able to make the setup we need to go through the following steps: AgreementGrantToken To enable us to send data to Economic, we ask you to follow the link and return the resulting code to us: https://secure.e-conomic.com/secure/api1/requestaccess.aspx?appPublicToken=bTdCvYFj4PtI8GMehfbrRWMeZLDlvpMluaTWb86z85U1 2. Accounts Together with this letter you should have received an Excel document in which you are supposed to write account numbers and possibly counter account numbers for the payment types and item groups that are used in the shop. A counter account is typically used for costs, money from POS to bank, and cost of goods sold. If you want a specific setup for each shop and/or range of POS’es you can just create new tabs in the Excel document, each containing a copy of the “template”, and fill in account numbers. The Excel document should be returned to us. 3. Test When the setup has been made we will send data for a given period to Economic. The purpose of this is to correct errors and misunderstandings. 4. Auto When testing is finished we will start the automated generation of data. This means that every night you should get data from the past day. Resending of data for a given period of time is always possible. However, we will have to send data for whole days and for at least one shop in the setup. This meaans that it is not possible to send data for a single POS or a payment type/item group that had been missed in the original setup. We expect the following returned from you: Name of draft in Economic (We will send data to the draft): AgreementGrantToken (text string, rather not a picture): The filled in Excel document/documents
title: Economic welcome letter
description:
Hi

 

An integration between DdD and Economic has been ordered. To be able to make the setup we need to go through the following steps: 

  

  1. AgreementGrantToken 

To enable us to send data to Economic, we ask you to follow the link and return the resulting code to us:

 

https://secure.e-conomic.com/secure/api1/requestaccess.aspx?appPublicToken=bTdCvYFj4PtI8GMehfbrRWMeZLDlvpMluaTWb86z85U1




  


 

  

2. Accounts 

Together with this letter you should have received an Excel document in which you are supposed to write account numbers and possibly counter account numbers for the payment types and item groups that are used in the shop. A counter account is typically used for costs, money from POS to bank, and cost of goods sold. 

 

If you want a specific setup for each shop and/or range of POS’es you can just create new tabs in the Excel document, each containing a copy of the “template”, and fill in account numbers.

 

The Excel document should be returned to us. 

 

  

3. Test 

When the setup has been made we will send data for a given period to Economic. The purpose of this is to correct errors and misunderstandings.

  

4. Auto 

When testing is finished we will start the automated generation of data. This means that every night you should get data from the past day.

 

Resending of data for a given period of time is always possible. However, we will have to send data for whole days and for at least one shop in the setup. This meaans that it is not possible to send data for a single POS or a payment type/item group that had been missed in the original setup.

 

We expect the following returned from you: 

  

Name of draft in Economic (We will send data to the draft): 

  

AgreementGrantToken (text string, rather not a picture): 

 

The filled in Excel document/documents

text: Wenn das MDE-Gerät zum Start einer Inventur nicht richtig mit der Kasse verbunden ist, können Sie folgende Schritte vornehmen: 1. Öffnen Sie "Funktion" in der Kasse 2. Klicken Sie anschließend auf System -> Kassenparameter 3. Klicken Sie anschließend auf "Alle Parameter" 4. Geben Sie im Suchfeld "SvMDeComPort" ein und bestätigen Sie mit der Eingabetaste (Enter) 5. Finde Sie den Parameter anhand den Werten "Typ" und "Dat" und klicken Sie diesen an 6. Geben Sie im Eingabefeld rechts oben die richtige ComPort Nummer ein Die richtige ComPort Nummer finden Sie im Windows Gerätemanager: - Drücken Sie die Tastenkombination "Windows-Logo" + "x" - Klicken Sie auf "Geräte-Manager" - Klicken Sie per Doppelklick auf "Anschlüsse" - Nun sehen Sie unter welchem ComPort das MDE-Gerät mit dem Namen "Silicon Labs..." angeschlossen ist. Wenn Sie sich unsicher sind, stecken Sie das MDE-Gerät aus und anschließend wieder ein und beobachten Sie welcher ComPort im Geräte-Manager verschwindet und wieder auftaucht. Handelt es sich beispielsweise wie im folgenden Screenshot um COM7, so müssen Sie im Eingabefeld in der Kasse (wie oben beschrieben) die Zahl "7" ein. Klicken Sie nach Eingabe der richtigen ComPort Nummer in der Kasse auf "OK" und anschließend auf "Speichern" Die Kasse startet sich nun automatisch neu und sollte das MDE-Gerät nun erkennen. Kontaktieren Sie den K3 Support, falls es dennoch nicht funktioniert.
title: Inventur Datenübertrabung: MDE-Gerät wird von Kasse nicht erkannt
description:
Wenn das MDE-Gerät zum Start einer Inventur nicht richtig mit der Kasse verbunden ist, können Sie folgende Schritte vornehmen:



1. Öffnen Sie "Funktion" in der Kasse

 

 

2. Klicken Sie anschließend auf System -> Kassenparameter

 

 

3. Klicken Sie anschließend auf "Alle Parameter"


4. Geben Sie im Suchfeld "SvMDeComPort" ein und bestätigen Sie mit der Eingabetaste (Enter)


5. Finde Sie den Parameter anhand den Werten "Typ" und "Dat" und klicken Sie diesen an

 

6. Geben Sie im Eingabefeld rechts oben die richtige ComPort Nummer ein


Die richtige ComPort Nummer finden Sie im Windows Gerätemanager:

- Drücken Sie die Tastenkombination "Windows-Logo" + "x"

- Klicken Sie auf "Geräte-Manager"

- Klicken Sie per Doppelklick auf "Anschlüsse"

- Nun sehen Sie unter welchem ComPort das MDE-Gerät mit dem Namen "Silicon Labs..." angeschlossen ist. Wenn Sie sich unsicher sind, stecken Sie das MDE-Gerät aus und anschließend wieder ein und beobachten Sie welcher ComPort im Geräte-Manager verschwindet und wieder auftaucht. Handelt es sich beispielsweise wie im folgenden Screenshot um COM7, so müssen Sie im Eingabefeld in der Kasse (wie oben beschrieben) die Zahl "7" ein.



Klicken Sie nach Eingabe der richtigen ComPort Nummer in der Kasse auf "OK" und anschließend auf "Speichern"

 

 

Die Kasse startet sich nun automatisch neu und sollte das MDE-Gerät nun erkennen. Kontaktieren Sie den K3 Support, falls es dennoch nicht funktioniert.

text: Sometimes you make a mistake when closing the day. Once the daily closing is printed, NO change is possible.
title: Is it possible to change an end of day report
description: Sometimes you make a mistake when closing the day. Once the daily closing is printed, NO change is possible.

text: If Cowiskasse does not start on the cash register PC and a similar message (Figure 1) appears, the cause is usually a non-started SQL server on the cash register PC. - Open the Windows services - look for the SQLServer service with the appropriate name (usually Cowis, Cowiskasse orSQLEXPRESS) - right click on the found service and "start" it - start Cowiskasse and it should work
title: Cowiskasse does not start - possibly the SQL server is not running
description:
If Cowiskasse does not start on the cash register PC and a similar message (Figure 1) appears, the cause is usually a non-started SQL server on the cash register PC.


- Open the Windows services

- look for the SQLServer service with the appropriate name (usually Cowis, Cowiskasse orSQLEXPRESS)

- right click on the found service and "start" it

- start Cowiskasse and it should work

text: Regardless of whether an expense receipt has been entered twice at the cowis cash register, or with an incorrect amount, the solution is usually the INPUT REPORT . Directly below the button for the expense receipt at the cash register is the button for the deposit receipt. This is used to deposit money into the cash register.
title: An expense document was entered incorrectly at the cash register
description:
Regardless of whether an expense receipt has been entered twice at the cowis cash register, or with an incorrect amount, the solution is usually the INPUT REPORT .

Directly below the button for the expense receipt at the cash register is the button for the deposit receipt. This is used to deposit money into the cash register.

text: Wenn der Handscanner nicht funktioniert, können Sie folgenden Schritten folgen: 1. Stecken Sie das Kabel des Scanners für 30 Sekunden aus und reinigen Sie das Glas des Scanners mit einem trockenen Tuch. 2. Stecken Sie das Kabel wieder ein 3. Starten Sie den PC neu 4. Versuchen Sie nun, eine Ware zu scannen Falls es immer noch nicht funktioniert, können Sie versuchen das Kabel auszutauschen, sofern Sie ein Ersatzkabel zugänglich haben. Andernfalls können Sie den K3 Support kontaktieren.
title: Handscanner: Scannen von Waren funktioniert nicht
description:
Wenn der Handscanner nicht funktioniert, können Sie folgenden Schritten folgen:

1. Stecken Sie das Kabel des Scanners für 30 Sekunden aus und reinigen Sie das Glas des Scanners mit einem trockenen Tuch.

2. Stecken Sie das Kabel wieder ein

3. Starten Sie den PC neu

4. Versuchen Sie nun, eine Ware zu scannen


Falls es immer noch nicht funktioniert, können Sie versuchen das Kabel auszutauschen, sofern Sie ein Ersatzkabel zugänglich haben. Andernfalls können Sie den K3 Support kontaktieren.

text: Wenn individuelle Texte auf dem Kassenbon gewünscht sind, wie "Schöne Weihnachten" oder "Frohe Ostern" kann man das PRO Kasse manuell einstellen: 1. Zuerst am besten eine Sicherung der vorhandenen Formulare durchführen: Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern Auslagern Alle OK Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT Speichern Formulare sind gesichert 2. Anschließend die Formulare ändern: Kasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formular-Verwaltung Formular Verkauf anklicken Formular klicken Editor öffnet sich Text an gewünschter Stelle einfügen Schließen Kreuz und Frage nach Speichern mit Ja beantworten
title: How can I change texts on the receipt
description:
Wenn individuelle Texte auf dem Kassenbon gewünscht sind, wie
"Schöne Weihnachten" oder "Frohe Ostern" kann man das PRO Kasse manuell einstellen:

1. Zuerst am besten eine Sicherung der vorhandenen Formulare durchführen:


Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern
Auslagern
Alle
OK

Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene
C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT
Speichern

Formulare sind gesichert

2. Anschließend die Formulare ändern:

Kasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formular-Verwaltung
Formular Verkauf anklicken
Formular klicken
Editor öffnet sich

Text an gewünschter Stelle einfügen


Schließen Kreuz und Frage nach Speichern mit Ja beantworten

text: To cancel a receipt, the receipt has to be from the same day and it can only be done before cash closing. On the POS: Funktion -> Erweitert -> Beleg stonieren -> find receipt and click OK Once the receipt has been cancled, it cannot be reactivated. If the customer wants to cancel a receipt after cash closing, this cannot be done. The sale has to be treated as a return.
title: Receipt - cancel
description:
To cancel a receipt, the receipt has to be from the same day and it can only be done before cash closing.

 

On the POS: 

 

Funktion -> Erweitert -> Beleg stonieren -> find receipt and click OK

 

 

 

 

Once the receipt has been cancled, it cannot be reactivated.

 

If the customer wants to cancel a receipt after cash closing, this cannot be done. The sale has to be treated as a return.

text: According to German law, your Cowiskassen software has a so-called “technical security device” (TSE for short). You can read what this means in this external link Erläuterung zur TSE The basic requirement for the TSE signing unit to function properly is an internet connection. If you receive a message at the Cowis checkout like the one in the following picture: This means that there is a malfunction from your cash register computer to the TSE signing office. This may be caused by: - YOUR internet failure - Internet failure in your city - Malfunction on the part of the FISKALY TSE signing unit All of these disruptions have primarily nothing to do with the Cowiskasse. After the corresponding malfunction has been eliminated, the TSE signing unit returns to its normal status. You can check whether there is a problem with FISKALY TSE here: FISKALY TSE STATUS
title: Error message on the Cowiskasse “Fiskaly TSE failed”
description:
According to German law, your Cowiskassen software has a so-called “technical security device” (TSE for short).

You can read what this means in this external link
Erläuterung zur TSE


The basic requirement for the TSE signing unit to function properly is an internet connection. 


If you receive a message at the Cowis checkout like the one in the following picture:


This means that there is a malfunction from your cash register computer to the TSE signing office. 


This may be caused by:

- YOUR internet failure

- Internet failure in your city

- Malfunction on the part of the FISKALY TSE signing unit


All of these disruptions have primarily nothing to do with the Cowiskasse. 


After the corresponding malfunction has been eliminated, the TSE signing unit returns to its normal status.


You can check whether there is a problem with FISKALY TSE here:

FISKALY TSE STATUS

text: The only way to connect a PayTerminal with Cowiskasse is the ZVT with a serial connection cable on the RS-232 interface. Cowiskasse do not support a connection to the POS via IP or any other different way than serial
title: Connecting PayTerminal to CowisKasse
description:
The only way to connect a PayTerminal with Cowiskasse is the ZVT with a serial connection cable on the RS-232 interface.


Cowiskasse do not support a connection to the POS via IP or any other different way than serial

text: If you want to create a new button for a reduction reason in the cash register, you must do this in merchandise management: Open the area Kassenabschlüsse->Datei->Reduzierungsgründe->Neu Here you can create a new reduction reason. If you wish, you can select status 1 when creating the reduction reason. This means that the following will NOT be printed on the receipt: "Reduced goods are excluded from exchange." With the next data exchange, the new reduction reason is then available as a "button" in the register
title: Create new reduction reason
description:
If you want to create a new button for a reduction reason in the cash register, you must do this in merchandise management:


Open the area Kassenabschlüsse->Datei->Reduzierungsgründe->Neu


Here you can create a new reduction reason.


If you wish, you can select status 1 when creating the reduction reason. This means that the following will NOT be printed on the receipt: "Reduced goods are excluded from exchange."


With the next data exchange, the new reduction reason is then available as a "button" in the register

text: Auswahl mitgeben Wenn Sie einem Kunden Ware zur Auswahl mitgeben ist folgendes zu tun: • Etiketten der entsprechenden Artikel einscannen • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ und wählen Sie im Anschluss die Zahlart „Auswahl“ aus Hinweis: Im Auslieferungszustand der C!Touch Kasse können Auswahlen nur mitgegeben werden, wenn zuvor ein Kunde gewählt wurde. Auswahl zurücknehmen / verkaufen Wenn der Kunde die mitgenommene Ware zurückbringt, bzw. kaufen möchte, gibt es verschiedene Möglichkeiten die Auswahl aufzurufen: • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Kunde“ und wählen Sie den entsprechenden Kunden aus • Wenn es von dem Kunden „offene Auswahlen“ gibt, erscheint der Button „Auswahl“ neben dem Kunden- Adressfeld (s. Abb.) • Tippen Sie auf den Button „Auswahl“ • Sie können nun im Fenster „Auswahl zurück“ (s. Abb.) die Auswahlbeleg-Nummer eintippen und mit Button „OK“ bestätigen oder • auf den Button „Auswahlen des Kunden“ tippen Abb. Auswahl zurück • In beiden Fällen erscheint das folgende Fenster, mit dem Unterschied, dass bei der direkten Eingabe der Auswahlbeleg-Nummer nur diese Auswahl erscheint Tippen Sie nun auf die Buttons „Verkaufen“ und/oder „Zurück“, je nachdem was der Kunde zurückbringen bzw. kaufen möchte, und anschließend auf „OK“ • Positionen, bei denen weder „Verkaufen“ noch „Zurück“ angetippt wurde, bleiben weiterhin in Auswahl • Wenn ein oder mehrere Artikel aus der Auswahl verkauft werden, können Sie den Verkaufsvorgang abschließen indem Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ tippen • Wenn die Auswahl nur zurück gegeben wird, kommt die folgende Abfrage: • Tippen Sie auf „Ja“ und es wird ein Beleg der zurückgebrachten Ware ausgedruckt Hinweis: Sie können auch eine Auswahl aufrufen, indem Sie auf den Button „Funktion“ tippen und innerhalb der Registerkarte „Allgemein“ die „Auswahl-Verwaltung“ auswählen. Danach erhalten Sie, wie auf der vorherigen Seite abgebildet, das Fenster „Auswahl zurück“.
title: Auswahl
description:
Auswahl mitgeben

Wenn Sie einem Kunden Ware zur Auswahl mitgeben ist folgendes zu tun:

• Etiketten der entsprechenden Artikel einscannen

• Tippen Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ und wählen Sie im Anschluss die Zahlart „Auswahl“ aus

Hinweis: Im Auslieferungszustand der C!Touch Kasse können Auswahlen nur mitgegeben werden, wenn zuvor ein

Kunde gewählt wurde.



Auswahl zurücknehmen / verkaufen

Wenn der Kunde die mitgenommene Ware zurückbringt, bzw. kaufen möchte, gibt es verschiedene Möglichkeiten

die Auswahl aufzurufen:

• Tippen Sie auf den Button „Kunde“ und wählen Sie den entsprechenden Kunden aus

• Wenn es von dem Kunden „offene Auswahlen“ gibt, erscheint der Button „Auswahl“ neben dem Kunden-

Adressfeld (s. Abb.)

• Tippen Sie auf den Button „Auswahl“

• Sie können nun im Fenster „Auswahl zurück“ (s. Abb.) die Auswahlbeleg-Nummer eintippen und mit

Button „OK“ bestätigen oder

• auf den Button „Auswahlen des Kunden“ tippen

Abb. Auswahl zurück

• In beiden Fällen erscheint das folgende Fenster, mit dem Unterschied, dass bei der direkten Eingabe der

Auswahlbeleg-Nummer nur diese Auswahl erscheint
Tippen Sie nun auf die Buttons „Verkaufen“ und/oder „Zurück“, je nachdem was der Kunde zurückbringen

bzw. kaufen möchte, und anschließend auf „OK“

• Positionen, bei denen weder „Verkaufen“ noch „Zurück“ angetippt wurde, bleiben weiterhin in Auswahl

• Wenn ein oder mehrere Artikel aus der Auswahl verkauft werden, können Sie den Verkaufsvorgang

abschließen indem Sie auf den Button „Bezahlen“ tippen

• Wenn die Auswahl nur zurück gegeben wird, kommt die folgende Abfrage:

• Tippen Sie auf „Ja“ und es wird ein Beleg der zurückgebrachten Ware ausgedruckt

Hinweis: Sie können auch eine Auswahl aufrufen, indem Sie auf den Button „Funktion“ tippen und innerhalb der

Registerkarte „Allgemein“ die „Auswahl-Verwaltung“ auswählen. Danach erhalten Sie, wie auf der vorherigen Seite

abgebildet, das Fenster „Auswahl zurück“.

text: Eine Anzahlung ist möglich indem Sie einen Kredit vergeben 1. Kunden erfassen 2. Gewünschtes Teil (Teile) einscannen 3. Klicken Sie auf bezahlen 4. Höhe der Anzahlung erfassen (in dem Beispiel 135,00 Euro bar), es kann aber auch jede andere Zahlart gewählt werden 5. Rest auf Zahlart Kredit erfassen Verkauf mit OK abschließen Es kommen Belege raus, Quittung und Kreditbeleg (im Standardlayout) Wenn die Kundin kommt um den Kredit zu bezahlen: 1. Kundin aufrufen 2. Position wählen Kredit bezahlen wählen Korrekten Kredit wählen Anklicken und mit OK in die Verkaufsposition übernehmen Abwicklung wie gewohnt -> bezahlen -> Zahlung durchführen
title: Anzahlung
description:
Eine Anzahlung ist möglich indem Sie einen Kredit vergeben


1. Kunden erfassen
2. Gewünschtes Teil (Teile) einscannen
 

3. Klicken Sie auf bezahlen

 
4. Höhe der Anzahlung erfassen (in dem Beispiel 135,00 Euro bar), es kann aber auch jede andere Zahlart gewählt werden
 


5. Rest auf Zahlart Kredit erfassen

 

Verkauf mit OK abschließen
 

 

Es kommen Belege raus, Quittung und Kreditbeleg (im Standardlayout)

 


Wenn die Kundin kommt um den Kredit zu bezahlen:


1. Kundin aufrufen
2. Position wählen
Kredit bezahlen wählen

 

Korrekten Kredit wählen

Anklicken und mit OK in die Verkaufsposition übernehmen

 

Abwicklung wie gewohnt -> bezahlen -> Zahlung durchführen

text: If I want a deposit from the customer, be it for an individual order or for any other reason, the only option at the Cowis checkout is to sell a gift voucher. It is a good idea to use the text "Deposit for XXX" as a comment.
title: How do I handle a deposit at the Cowis checkout?
description:
If I want a deposit from the customer, be it for an individual order or for any other reason, the only option at the Cowis checkout is to sell a gift voucher.


It is a good idea to use the text "Deposit for XXX" as a comment.

text: Sellers are created in the Cowis.Net back office and then transferred to the cash register using the regular data exchange. First open the "Addresses" area and either open an existing contact or create a new contact via "New". An address becomes an employee address by activating the "Employee" checkbox. If the address should also be sent to the cash register as a salesperson, switch to the "Employee" tab Here you assign a salesperson number (you CANNOT create a salesperson number in the possible drop-down menu, this drop-down is only to show you which salesperson numbers have already been assigned) Then you define the main branch of this salesperson, assign the authorization group and determine what should be printed on the cash register receipt as "You were served .......... This process is completed by saving.
title: Create sellers for the Cowiskasse
description:
Sellers are created in the Cowis.Net back office and then transferred to the cash register using the regular data exchange.


First open the "Addresses" area and either open an existing contact or create a new contact via "New".

An address becomes an employee address by activating the "Employee" checkbox.



If the address should also be sent to the cash register as a salesperson, switch to the "Employee" tab


Here you assign a salesperson number (you CANNOT create a salesperson number in the possible drop-down menu, this drop-down is only to show you which salesperson numbers have already been assigned)


Then you define the main branch of this salesperson, assign the authorization group and determine what should be printed on the cash register receipt as "You were served ..........



This process is completed by saving.

text: If you need POS data for a certain period for the tax department, do as follows: Open POS -> Funktion -> TSE -> Export Set start date (Startdatum) and end date (Enddatum) and click OK The data will be exported to the indicated folder (usually Cowis/CowisKasse into a folder called TSE Export.
title: TSE Info Export
description:
If you need POS data for a certain period for the tax department, do as follows:

 

Open POS -> Funktion -> TSE -> Export

 

 

 

Set start date (Startdatum) and end date (Enddatum) and click OK

 

 

 

The data will be exported to the indicated folder (usually Cowis/CowisKasse into a folder called TSE Export.

text: Normally, the basic setting of the Cowis cash register is such that all sellers are displayed on the overview screen. Access can be protected by a password. (in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net merchandise management system) However, there is also the option of processing identification using a barcode (or entering a numerical code) In the parameters for the Cowis cash register in the Cowis.Net back office, there is the parameter "KaSvVerkIdent". This controls the type of seller identification at the Cowis cash register. If you change this parameter and set it to "1", the login screen at the Cowis cash register looks like this: If you then enter either a barcode in plain text or a number (like 02543236 here) in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net back office, the seller can use this at the cash register can access the cash register using this number or card barcode. This is how it is intended to be handled
title: Identification of the seller at the Cowis cash register
description:
Normally, the basic setting of the Cowis cash register is such that all sellers are displayed on the overview screen.

Access can be protected by a password.

(in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net merchandise management system)


However, there is also the option of processing identification using a barcode (or entering a numerical code)


In the parameters for the Cowis cash register in the Cowis.Net back office, there is the parameter "KaSvVerkIdent". This controls the type of seller identification at the Cowis cash register.


If you change this parameter and set it to "1", the login screen at the Cowis cash register looks like this:


If you then enter either a barcode in plain text or a number (like 02543236 here) in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net back office, the seller can use this at the cash register can access the cash register using this number or card barcode.


This is how it is intended to be handled

text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them
title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
description:
To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office.

Go to System


Then to Parameters


Select payment methods


In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed


Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited)

Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register

Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide)

Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here

Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection

Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal

Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged)


The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange


A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button


Then you enter the values you want and save them

text: Working hours and breaks can be recorded in the Cowiskasse. Corrections are NOT possible in the Cowiskasse. To carry out the recording, the seller logs in to the cash register Then select the function The Time Recording button can be found on the Advanced tab Once selected, you must select your seller name again After identification, the window for recording the type of time recording opens. Cowiskasse differentiates between "coming" and "going" When you have arrived for work, press "coming" The coming entry is set Then press close Break When you go on a break, you normally select going So you go the same way again: Function -> Advanced -> Time recording (in this example, the employee worked for 2 minutes before going on a break) When you return from the break, you obviously have to book coming again, so the route is again Function -> Advanced -> Time Recording End of work When you have finished work or your shift is over, use the going function in time recording one last time Function -> Advanced -> Time recording This concludes the working day. You can of course make as many coming and going bookings on one day as you like. Cowiskasse is not limited to a number here. Likewise, the way in which the coming and going bookings are made is generally specified by your employer. The evaluation of working hours takes place in the Cowis.Net back office
title: Recording working hours in Cowiskasse
description:
Working hours and breaks can be recorded in the Cowiskasse.

Corrections are NOT possible in the Cowiskasse.


To carry out the recording, the seller logs in to the cash register




Then select the function


The Time Recording button can be found on the Advanced tab


Once selected, you must select your seller name again



After identification, the window for recording the type of time recording opens.

Cowiskasse differentiates between "coming" and "going"


When you have arrived for work, press "coming"

The coming entry is set

Then press close



Break

When you go on a break, you normally select going

So you go the same way again:

Function -> Advanced -> Time recording

(in this example, the employee worked for 2 minutes before going on a break)



When you return from the break, you obviously have to book coming again, so the route is again

Function -> Advanced -> Time Recording




End of work

When you have finished work or your shift is over, use the going function in time recording one last time

Function -> Advanced -> Time recording


This concludes the working day.

You can of course make as many coming and going bookings on one day as you like. Cowiskasse is not limited to a number here. Likewise, the way in which the coming and going bookings are made is generally specified by your employer.



The evaluation of working hours takes place in the Cowis.Net back office

text: Good to know: The Cowiskasse absolutely requires the so-called SQL server from Microsoft to be used. This is a program from Microsoft that manages all of your Cowiskasse data. The installation and setup is carried out by DdD. The SQL server usually always starts automatically and does not cause any problems. (You will notice the restriction) In certain situations it may happen that the SQL server has not yet started, but the Cowiskasse already wants to access it, in which case you will receive a message like this: You can now try to get the SQL server to start before the Cowiskasse needs it by restarting the cash register computer, or you can use this short "How do I help myself?" You need the local service operator of the Windows operating system: You click on the Windows start symbol (this can look like Windows 10, or be the well-known Windows 7 "ball"), you can also press the Windows symbol on your keyboard. Now you can simply type in the word "Services". (Basically you could also write "Dienste", but since there is a possibility that you have an English operating system, "Dienste" would not help you, whereas the German operating system can handle both "Dienste" and "Services".) The "tree" opens, which shows you the program with the highest match in the first place, this should be Dienste (or Services). You open this program by clicking on it A new window opens with the title "Services" (or Services) Now scroll with the scroll bar on the right until you get to the letter S There you look for an entry that contains the word "SQL Server". Usually followed by the word "COWIS" or "COWISKASSE", i.e. "SQL Server COWIS" or "SQL SERVER COWISKASSE". There will (most likely) be nothing in the "Status" column and "automatic" in the startup type column. This means that the SQL Server should "actually" start automatically but is not currently running. To start the SQL Server, click on the entry once with the left mouse button so that it is highlighted in blue. Now click on "start" in the top left corner In the best case, the status has changed to "running" and you can close the window and then start your Cowiskasse normally again. If you are unsure, it is always a good choice to contact support if possible.
title: Cowiskasse does not start, an error message appears
description:
Good to know:

The Cowiskasse absolutely requires the so-called SQL server from Microsoft to be used.


This is a program from Microsoft that manages all of your Cowiskasse data. The installation and setup is carried out by DdD.


The SQL server usually always starts automatically and does not cause any problems. (You will notice the restriction)


In certain situations it may happen that the SQL server has not yet started, but the Cowiskasse already wants to access it, in which case you will receive a message like this:


You can now try to get the SQL server to start before the Cowiskasse needs it by restarting the cash register computer, or you can use this short "How do I help myself?"


You need the local service operator of the Windows operating system:

You click on the Windows start symbol (this can look like Windows 10, or be the well-known Windows 7 "ball"), you can also press the Windows symbol on your keyboard.


Now you can simply type in the word "Services".


(Basically you could also write "Dienste", but since there is a possibility that you have an English operating system, "Dienste" would not help you, whereas the German operating system can handle both "Dienste" and "Services".)


The "tree" opens, which shows you the program with the highest match in the first place, this should be Dienste (or Services).


You open this program by clicking on it



A new window opens with the title "Services" (or Services)



Now scroll with the scroll bar on the right until you get to the letter S



There you look for an entry that contains the word "SQL Server". Usually followed by the word "COWIS" or "COWISKASSE", i.e. "SQL Server COWIS" or "SQL SERVER COWISKASSE".



There will (most likely) be nothing in the "Status" column and "automatic" in the startup type column. This means that the SQL Server should "actually" start automatically but is not currently running.



To start the SQL Server, click on the entry once with the left mouse button so that it is highlighted in blue.


Now click on "start" in the top left corner





In the best case, the status has changed to "running" and you can close the window and then start your Cowiskasse normally again.


If you are unsure, it is always a good choice to contact support if possible.

text: If you have deleted a printjob in Cowis, but it still keeps printing, that means that the print queue in Windows has not been deleted. You have two ways to correct this problem. 1. You can shut down your PC and your printer, leave them off for 30 seconds, and restart both. That should clear the print queue. 2. Empty the print queue in Windows for your specific printer. Windows 11: 1. Search for printers and scanners 2. Double click the printer name 3. Open the print queue 4. Delete Windows 10: 1. Search for printes and scanners 2. Click on the printer name 3. Click Open Queue 4. Click Printer 5. Click Cancel All Documents Windows 7: 1. Click Start 2. Click Devices and Printers 3. Double click on the printer name 4. Click Printer 5. Click Cancel all Documents
title: Printjob deleted in Cowis still prints
description:
If you have deleted a printjob in Cowis, but it still keeps printing, that means that the print queue in Windows has not been deleted. You have two ways to correct this problem.


1. You can shut down your PC and your printer, leave them off for 30 seconds, and restart both. That should clear the print queue.


2. Empty the print queue in Windows for your specific printer.


Windows 11: 


1. Search for printers and scanners

2. Double click the printer name

3. Open the print queue

4. Delete


Windows 10:


1. Search for printes and scanners

2. Click on the printer name

3. Click Open Queue

4. Click Printer

5. Click Cancel All Documents

     


Windows 7:


1. Click Start

2. Click Devices and Printers

3. Double click on the printer name

4. Click Printer

5. Click Cancel all Documents

text: If the POS does not save a receipt but the card terminal prints the receipt, the sale must be repeated, but you first need to detach the card terminal in Cowis POS. Click on Funktion 1. System 2. KassenParameter 3. Alle Parameter 4. PinpadProdukt (in this case it will be on 4 = ZVT (Standard)) Change it to 0 = Inaktiv. 5. Speichern The POS will restart, the customer can now repeat the sale and use Pin-Pad as payment. Once the receipt has been printed, repeat the above process and set the PinpadProdukt back to 4 = ZVT (Standard). The POS will restart again and the sale has now been saved.
title: POS did not save receipt
description:
If the POS does not save a receipt but the card terminal prints the receipt, the sale must be repeated, but you first need to detach the card terminal in Cowis POS.


Click on Funktion



1. System


2. KassenParameter


3. Alle Parameter


4. PinpadProdukt (in this case it will be on 4 = ZVT (Standard)) Change it to 0 = Inaktiv.


5. Speichern



The POS will restart, the customer can now repeat the sale and use Pin-Pad as payment. Once the receipt has been printed, repeat the above process and set the PinpadProdukt back to 4 = ZVT (Standard).


The POS will restart again and the sale has now been saved.

text: The new EU-wide Product Safety Regulation (also GPSR) will come into force on December 13, 2024. This will impose a number of obligations on retailers who operate an online shop. You as a retailer are responsible for implementing the GPSR in your online shop; we as the provider of merchandise management and, if applicable, your online shop can support you with technical means. If you are not sure how to implement the GPSR, seek legal advice! We cannot give you legally secure information. The GPSR implementation can be complex for you as a retailer. The GPSR only affects products that are put into circulation after December 13, 2024, at least that is OUR knowledge. For you, this would mean that you would not have to revise the products you have offered so far. (This is not a legally binding technical statement) The help articles in the directory describe measures that will help you use Cowis appropriately to support implementation.
title: What is the GPSR?
description:
The new EU-wide Product Safety Regulation (also GPSR) will come into force on December 13, 2024. This will impose a number of obligations on retailers who operate an online shop.

You as a retailer are responsible for implementing the GPSR in your online shop; we as the provider of merchandise management and, if applicable, your online shop can support you with technical means.


If you are not sure how to implement the GPSR, seek legal advice!


We cannot give you legally secure information.


The GPSR implementation can be complex for you as a retailer.


The GPSR only affects products that are put into circulation after December 13, 2024, at least that is OUR knowledge.


For you, this would mean that you would not have to revise the products you have offered so far. (This is not a legally binding technical statement)


The help articles in the directory describe measures that will help you use Cowis appropriately to support implementation.

text: Dear customers, the new General Product Safety Regulation (GPSR) of the European Union will come into force on December 13, 2024. This regulation will significantly tighten the product safety requirements for all non-food products sold on the EU market. As a provider of a merchandise management system, we would like to draw your attention to the upcoming changes and help you to be prepared in good time. What does the GPSR mean for retailers and manufacturers? Product safety obligations: Products must meet the new requirements of the GPSR before they can be sold. Extended information obligations: Warnings and safety information must be available in the respective national languages of the EU member states. Traceable supply chains: The traceability of products must be guaranteed in order to be able to react quickly to safety problems. Sanctions for violations: Companies that do not meet the requirements must expect stricter controls and potential penalties. How COWIS can support you With COWIS you can efficiently ensure compliance with the new regulations: Product data management: Centrally manage all safety-relevant information and documentation. Our tip for you: If you are a COWIS DdD eShop customer, you have the option of storing all manufacturer-relevant information in the shop in the form of a CSV file. If necessary, please contact Mr. Maretzke directly at markus.maretzke@k3btg.com. He will support you with this. (This service may be subject to a fee and is calculated depending on the effort involved). Multilingual integration: Store the required warnings and safety information for all EU languages in your system. Our tip for you: Actively use CHAT GPT to quickly and easily translate the manufacturer-relevant information into all necessary languages. Traceability: Make sure that the supply chain of your products is fully documented in order to meet legal requirements. Act in good time! The GPSR brings with it numerous changes that require careful preparation. We would be happy to help you adapt your processes accordingly and be optimally prepared for the new regulations. We are available at any time for further information or individual advice. Best regards, Your DdD COWIS team
title: Published Cowis News (11/18/2024)
description:
Dear customers,


the new General Product Safety Regulation (GPSR) of the European Union will come into force on December 13, 2024. This regulation will significantly tighten the product safety requirements for all non-food products sold on the EU market. As a provider of a merchandise management system, we would like to draw your attention to the upcoming changes and help you to be prepared in good time.


What does the GPSR mean for retailers and manufacturers?


Product safety obligations: Products must meet the new requirements of the GPSR before they can be sold.

Extended information obligations: Warnings and safety information must be available in the respective national languages of the EU member states.

Traceable supply chains: The traceability of products must be guaranteed in order to be able to react quickly to safety problems.

Sanctions for violations: Companies that do not meet the requirements must expect stricter controls and potential penalties. How COWIS can support you


With COWIS you can efficiently ensure compliance with the new regulations:


Product data management: Centrally manage all safety-relevant information and documentation.

Act in good time!


The GPSR brings with it numerous changes that require careful preparation. We would be happy to help you adapt your processes accordingly and be optimally prepared for the new regulations.


We are available at any time for further information or individual advice.


Best regards,

Your DdD COWIS team

text: You need a current Cowis UPDate. This is how you read an update into Cowis Since the GPSR requires the specification of a manufacturer for articles, and the supplier is not always the manufacturer, we had to create a new feature in the addresses area. Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the internet search functions to find out how a manufacturer defines itself. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this.) You will first notice this in the list layer of addresses. If you create a new manufacturer address, you can define whether this is a pure manufacturer address by activating the manufacturer checkbox. The following applies to pure manufacturer addresses: Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this. If you would like to edit an existing supplier address in order to also activate the manufacturer checkbox, select the address to be changed with Change (or F7), activate the manufacturer checkbox by clicking on the checkbox with the mouse and save the change by either pressing F2 or clicking the Save button with the mouse. change selected address click on the checkbox with the mouse and activate it Save the change with F2 or with the Save symbol As it is possible that all of your suppliers are manufacturers at the same time, there will be a follow-up update that makes it possible to automatically activate the checkbox for marked addresses. (However, there will be no check to see whether you have marked customer, employee or supplier addresses, you must be careful here) If you have only maintained your supplier addresses rudimentarily in the past, it is high time to complete all the missing information so that the address also meets the GPSR requirements. Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you any legally binding information on this.)
title: Maintaining the manufacturer ID in the addresses
description:
You need a current Cowis UPDate.
This is how you read an update into Cowis



Since the GPSR requires the specification of a manufacturer for articles, and the supplier is not always the manufacturer, we had to create a new feature in the addresses area.


Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the internet search functions to find out how a manufacturer defines itself. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this.)



You will first notice this in the list layer of addresses.



If you create a new manufacturer address, you can define whether this is a pure manufacturer address by activating the manufacturer checkbox. The following applies to pure manufacturer addresses:


Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you legally binding information on this.



If you would like to edit an existing supplier address in order to also activate the manufacturer checkbox, select the address to be changed with Change (or F7), activate the manufacturer checkbox by clicking on the checkbox with the mouse and save the change by either pressing F2 or clicking the Save button with the mouse.



change selected address


click on the checkbox with the mouse and activate it



Save the change with F2 or with the Save symbol



As it is possible that all of your suppliers are manufacturers at the same time, there will be a follow-up update that makes it possible to automatically activate the checkbox for marked addresses.

(However, there will be no check to see whether you have marked customer, employee or supplier addresses, you must be careful here)



If you have only maintained your supplier addresses rudimentarily in the past, it is high time to complete all the missing information so that the address also meets the GPSR requirements.


Please ask your specialist lawyer or use the Internet search functions to find out what requirements the GPSR has for manufacturer addresses. (We cannot give you any legally binding information on this.)

text: You need a current Cowis update This is how you load a Cowis update In the items section, you must first create a new item property. You do this as follows In your Cowis.Net back office inventory management system, go to the items section Next, go to Settings In the menu that opens, go to Standard settings and then select the item "Configuration properties (keywords)" Depending on how many properties you have already defined, the list displayed will be longer or shorter. You now need to create the new keyword field "ManufacturerArdId" To do this, click on NEW as usual in Cowis.Net or press F5 An empty line is created, the cursor is automatically in the Type field Press F9 (for the list of predefined properties) or use the drop-down menu. Scroll down until you get to the last entry, this has the number 25 and is ManufacturerAdrID Select this with OK or double-click with the mouse, the entry will be added to the list of configured properties. Leave the checkboxes for "Active" and "Visible in article" active (do not change them) We also strongly advise against changing the suggested article sorting. Or to put it more clearly: Leave the sorting order as the program suggests. You can now save this by clicking OK or F2. The entry is now in the list Exit the window for the configuration properties with OK or Back or Close X You can find out how to store the ManufacturerAdrID for an article here:
title: Creating the article property ManufacturerAddressId
description:
You need a current Cowis update

This is how you load a Cowis update


In the items section, you must first create a new item property.

You do this as follows


In your Cowis.Net back office inventory management system, go to the items section



Next, go to Settings




In the menu that opens, go to Standard settings and then select the item "Configuration properties (keywords)"


Depending on how many properties you have already defined, the list displayed will be longer or shorter.



You now need to create the new keyword field "ManufacturerArdId"

To do this, click on NEW as usual in Cowis.Net or press F5



An empty line is created, the cursor is automatically in the Type field



Press F9 (for the list of predefined properties) or use the drop-down menu.

Scroll down until you get to the last entry, this has the number 25 and is ManufacturerAdrID



Select this with OK or double-click with the mouse, the entry will be added to the list of configured properties.


Leave the checkboxes for "Active" and "Visible in article" active (do not change them)

We also strongly advise against changing the suggested article sorting. Or to put it more clearly:

Leave the sorting order as the program suggests.


You can now save this by clicking OK or F2.


The entry is now in the list


Exit the window for the configuration properties with OK or Back or Close X



You can find out how to store the ManufacturerAdrID for an article here:

text: After you have learned here "Creating the article property ManufacturerAddressId" how to create the property field for the manufacturer address ID in the article, you will now learn how to insert the manufacturer address ID into a new article. When you create a new item, you will find the area with item properties on the "Additional information" tab. The "Manufacturer address ID" property is displayed here. On the "Manufacturer address ID" article property, you can use the dropdown menu or the F9 key to call up a list of all the manufacturers that have been created. You select the appropriate manufacturer for this article with OK or a double click In the window that opens, click OK or press Enter and the selected entry is transferred to the article property You can now save your article
title: Entering the manufacturer address ID for a new article
description:
After you have learned here "Creating the article property ManufacturerAddressId" how to create the property field for the manufacturer address ID in the article, you will now learn how to insert the manufacturer address ID into a new article.



When you create a new item, you will find the area with item properties on the "Additional information" tab.

The "Manufacturer address ID" property is displayed here.



On the "Manufacturer address ID" article property, you can use the dropdown menu or the F9 key to call up a list of all the manufacturers that have been created. You select the appropriate manufacturer for this article with OK or a double click 


In the window that opens, click OK or press Enter and the selected entry is transferred to the article property



You can now save your article

text: If you want to store the manufacturer address ID for an individual article, call up the article using Change and store the appropriate manufacturer address ID. As this process is no different from other processes when you subsequently change an article property, we will not go into this explicitly here. You can also store a manufacturer address ID for several marked articles. This is done using the standard editing function "edit marked articles". First, mark all articles to which you want to assign a specific manufacturer address ID. (in this example, the supplier "Zo-Zi") You can also make selections for articles that are only assigned to the online shop (see selection "belong to platform") Then go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked articles Select Assign article property Under "How should it be changed": Instead of old entry You can select this from the drop-down menu Then in the "Keyword" area select any of the 4 predefined keyword fields using the drop-down menu and select the entry "ManufacturerAdrID". You activate the "Change" checkbox and either select the manufacturer's address ID that matches the marked articles from the drop-down menu under Value or enter the address ID manually. Finally, click on Execute You will receive a message window that the property has been changed for X articles. Confirm this message with OK, then you will be back in the original window You can close this window with Cancel or exit by closing X The check shows that the manufacturer address ID is now stored in the articles. As always: If you are unsure, contact support
title: Storing the manufacturer address ID for existing articles
description:
If you want to store the manufacturer address ID for an individual article, call up the article using Change and store the appropriate manufacturer address ID.


As this process is no different from other processes when you subsequently change an article property, we will not go into this explicitly here.





You can also store a manufacturer address ID for several marked articles.


This is done using the standard editing function "edit marked articles".




First, mark all articles to which you want to assign a specific manufacturer address ID.


(in this example, the supplier "Zo-Zi")


You can also make selections for articles that are only assigned to the online shop (see selection "belong to platform")



Then go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked articles



Select Assign article property



Under "How should it be changed": Instead of old entry


You can select this from the drop-down menu



Then in the "Keyword" area select any of the 4 predefined keyword fields using the drop-down menu and select the entry "ManufacturerAdrID".



You activate the "Change" checkbox and either select the manufacturer's address ID that matches the marked articles from the drop-down menu under Value or enter the address ID manually.



Finally, click on Execute


You will receive a message window that the property has been changed for X articles.



Confirm this message with OK, then you will be back in the original window

You can close this window with Cancel or exit by closing X



The check shows that the manufacturer address ID is now stored in the articles.


As always:

If you are unsure, contact support

text: You need the latest Cowis.Net UPDate (at least 6.4.60 from December 1st, 2024) This is how you load a Cowis update If you want to activate the checkbox for the manufacturer for several suppliers, you can now do this in the address area. IMPORTANT: Cowis does not check whether the addresses you have marked are supplier addresses. You mark the supplier addresses you want to edit in the addresses area. In the example, 6 addresses of suppliers are marked You go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked addresses There you select "Supplier = Manufacturer" You click OK If you have a cash register connection, this question appears, here you can press YES Cowis asks you whether you want to delete the marking of the addresses Yes or No (If you click no, the changed addresses remain marked and you can more easily check whether the "Manufacturer" checkbox has been activated) You can see that the manufacturer checkbox is activated. You can now maintain the manufacturer ID in the articles. The manufacturer's address ID is now identical to the supplier's address ID Storing the manufacturer address ID for existing articles Don't forget to unmark the addresses (CTRL+e) And as always: If you are unsure, ask support.
title: Activate manufacturer address ID collectively
description:
You need the latest Cowis.Net UPDate (at least 6.4.60 from December 1st, 2024)

This is how you load a Cowis update


If you want to activate the checkbox for the manufacturer for several suppliers, you can now do this in the address area.


IMPORTANT: Cowis does not check whether the addresses you have marked are supplier addresses.


You mark the supplier addresses you want to edit in the addresses area.


In the example, 6 addresses of suppliers are marked



You go to Extras -> Other -> Edit marked addresses



There you select "Supplier = Manufacturer"


You click OK



If you have a cash register connection, this question appears, here you can press YES



Cowis asks you whether you want to delete the marking of the addresses Yes or No


(If you click no, the changed addresses remain marked and you can more easily check whether the "Manufacturer" checkbox has been activated)



You can see that the manufacturer checkbox is activated.

You can now maintain the manufacturer ID in the articles.

The manufacturer's address ID is now identical to the supplier's address ID

Storing the manufacturer address ID for existing articles



Don't forget to unmark the addresses (CTRL+e)


And as always:

If you are unsure, ask support.
