text: If you have branches with Cowis cash registers that are not on the same network as your Cowis.Net inventory management system, the data must be transferred from and to the cash registers. For external branches, a so-called VPN (virtual private network) is required. The customer (i.e. you) must provide this VPN. In the past, it may have happened that due to the customer not having a hardware partner, Cowis Support presented you with an alternative option and possibly installed and set it up. This was the "Hamachi" software (Logmein). Cowis Support bears no responsibility for this software, cannot support it and cannot help with problems. If you would like to use Cowis Support's help for this 3rd party software, this is a paid service. We recommend that you have a VPN set up by a local hardware or software partner.
title: What is Hamachi and why can't support help you here?
description:
If you have branches with Cowis cash registers that are not on the same network as your Cowis.Net inventory management system, the data must be transferred from and to the cash registers.


For external branches, a so-called VPN (virtual private network) is required.


The customer (i.e. you) must provide this VPN.


In the past, it may have happened that due to the customer not having a hardware partner, Cowis Support presented you with an alternative option and possibly installed and set it up.


This was the "Hamachi" software (Logmein).


Cowis Support bears no responsibility for this software, cannot support it and cannot help with problems.


If you would like to use Cowis Support's help for this 3rd party software, this is a paid service.


We recommend that you have a VPN set up by a local hardware or software partner.

text: There are two solutions: 1. Under Inventory (Inventur), you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID. 2. You can export a Dat-file from Cowis, where you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID.: 1. Choose where to save the file and what to name it. Click on the three dots to rename the file. 2. Choose Artikel to get alle information of the articles 3. Highlight all the articles you need (you can also choose to highlight only one article) 4. Tick nterne EAN-Codes exportieren 5. Click OK The Dat-file will be saved in the desired location. You can now import it into Excel to see the EAN Codes.
title: Find EAN Code for an item
description:
There are two solutions:


1. Under Inventory (Inventur), you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID.


2. You can export a Dat-file from Cowis, where you can also see the EAN Code if you have the Article ID.:





1. Choose where to save the file and what to name it. Click on the three dots to rename the file.


2. Choose Artikel to get alle information of the articles


3. Highlight all the articles you need (you can also choose to highlight only one article)


4. Tick nterne EAN-Codes exportieren


5. Click OK


The Dat-file will be saved in the desired location. You can now import it into Excel to see the EAN Codes.

text: When you call up the menu item "Extras / Enter payments", DdD Cowis shows you the outstanding amount of the invoices in the "Payments" window. This display refers to the complete transaction you are on when you call up the menu item. If you press the [F5] key here, you will receive a selection list in which all invoices for this complete transaction are listed. When you confirm an invoice, it is transferred to the "Payments" window. If the invoice amount was not paid in full immediately, you can correct the amount if necessary. The remaining amount is then displayed in the "still outstanding" field. If the invoice is within the discount period, DdD Cowis will inform you of this when you select the invoice and you can use the "Yes / No" button to grant a discount or not. For complete transactions for which there is also a credit note, you will be asked whether the invoice should be offset against the credit note or not when you select the invoice. If you answer this question with "Yes", you must select the corresponding credit note from the selection list and confirm it. You must then enter the remaining amount of the invoice as a payment receipt.
title: Enter payment in order processing
description:
When you call up the menu item "Extras / Enter payments", DdD Cowis shows you the outstanding amount of the invoices in the "Payments" window. This display refers to the complete transaction you are on when you call up the menu item.


If you press the [F5] key here, you will receive a selection list in which all invoices for this complete transaction are listed. When you confirm an invoice, it is transferred to the "Payments" window. If the invoice amount was not paid in full immediately, you can correct the amount if necessary. The remaining amount is then displayed in the "still outstanding" field. If the invoice is within the discount period, DdD Cowis will inform you of this when you select the invoice and you can use the "Yes / No" button to grant a discount or not. For complete transactions for which there is also a credit note, you will be asked whether the invoice should be offset against the credit note or not when you select the invoice. If you answer this question with "Yes", you must select the corresponding credit note from the selection list and confirm it. You must then enter the remaining amount of the invoice as a payment receipt.

text: sind Sie bitte so gut und senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung, damit die Entwicklung direkt mit Ihren Parametern und Einstellungen schauen kann. So senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung: Sie öffnen mit einem Internetbrowser diesen Link Transfer Now (https://www.transfernow.net/de) Nachdem Sie auf Start geklickt haben Navigieren Sie in Ihrem Windows Explorer zum Verzeichnis (Ordner) Backup innerhalb Ihres Cowis.Net Verzeichnisses, im Regelfall L:\Cowis.Net\Backup Hier wählen Sie dann das letzte (aktuellste) Backup aus, dies sollte das Datum vor dem heutigen Tag tragen Hier tragen Sie Ihre E-Mail Adresse ein Geben Ihren Absendernamen ein Klicken Sie anschließend auf das Schloss-Symbol (Im Screenshot rot eingekreist). Tragen Sie ein Passwort ein und klicken Sie auf "Bestätigen": Bei E-Mail des Empfängers tragen Sie bitte ein: Igor.Kyselov@k3btg.com Bei Betreff können Sie eintragen: Ihre Firmenname und Datensicherung Cowis Nachricht ist optional Dann klicken Sie auf Übertragen Wir erhalten dadurch eine Möglichkeit Ihre Datensicherung zu nutzen um das von Ihnen geschilderte Anliegen schneller und mit Ihren Daten zu analysieren Bitte teilen Sie uns das Passwort, das Sie in Transfernow eingetragen, als Antwort auf diese Nachricht mit. Sobald wir die Datei von Transfernow heruntergeladen haben, bekommen Sie eine E-Mail hierzu. Bitte löschen Sie die Datei anschliessend von Transfernow. Wir melden uns dann mit einem Ergebnis / Lösung
title: transfer a backup for our development
description:
sind Sie bitte so gut und senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung, damit die Entwicklung direkt mit Ihren Parametern und Einstellungen schauen kann.

So senden Sie uns eine Datensicherung:
Sie öffnen mit einem Internetbrowser diesen Link
Transfer Now
(https://www.transfernow.net/de)

Nachdem Sie auf Start geklickt haben
Navigieren Sie in Ihrem Windows Explorer zum Verzeichnis (Ordner) Backup innerhalb Ihres Cowis.Net Verzeichnisses, im Regelfall L:\Cowis.Net\Backup
Hier wählen Sie dann das letzte (aktuellste) Backup aus, dies sollte das Datum vor dem heutigen Tag tragen

Hier tragen Sie Ihre E-Mail Adresse ein
Geben Ihren Absendernamen ein

Klicken Sie anschließend auf das Schloss-Symbol (Im Screenshot rot eingekreist).

Tragen Sie ein Passwort ein und klicken Sie auf "Bestätigen":

Bei E-Mail des Empfängers tragen Sie bitte ein:
Igor.Kyselov@k3btg.com

Bei Betreff können Sie eintragen: Ihre Firmenname und Datensicherung Cowis
Nachricht ist optional
Dann klicken Sie auf Übertragen

Wir erhalten dadurch eine Möglichkeit Ihre Datensicherung zu nutzen um das von Ihnen geschilderte Anliegen schneller und mit Ihren Daten zu analysieren

Bitte teilen Sie uns das Passwort, das Sie in Transfernow eingetragen, als Antwort auf diese Nachricht mit.

Sobald wir die Datei von Transfernow heruntergeladen haben, bekommen Sie eine E-Mail hierzu. Bitte löschen Sie die Datei anschliessend von Transfernow.

Wir melden uns dann mit einem Ergebnis / Lösung

text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them
title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
description:
To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office.

Go to System


Then to Parameters


Select payment methods


In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed


Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited)

Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register

Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide)

Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here

Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection

Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal

Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged)


The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange


A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button


Then you enter the values you want and save them

text: If the working hours have been recorded in the Cowiskasse, they are transferred to the Cowis.Net back office via data exchange. The working hours can be found in the area "Cash register closings" -> File -> Time recording In this area it is possible to make corrections, delete entries or add them manually. (To what extent this is permissible under working hour law, please ask a legal advisor) Correct entry Select the entry to be corrected with a click and then select Change (or F7) The employee in this example has a verifiable start time of 7:55 a.m., so we change the 1st arrival entry of the day to the correct time. After you have selected Change (or F7), press Enter until you are in the TIME cell and change the entry to the correct time. Press Enter or save the entry with F2 or by clicking Save When the entry has been saved, #### appears in the booking type, this is a hint for the user to make a manual change. (You may need to adjust the cell width) You can also delete entries, select the entry to be deleted and use the F8 or Delete key. Enter entry If, for whatever reason, you are forced to enter an entry manually, proceed as follows. Select NEW (or F5) An empty line is created with the starting position on the personnel number Either you know the employee number or you use the drop-down function or press F9 (that stands for list) In this example, we only have 2 employees We now enter working hours for Mr. Völkner on October 29, 2024 from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with a break from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. A total of 4 entries are required for this We select the seller and press Enter The initial approach is that Cowis.Net suggests "Go". As this makes no sense for the first booking, it is important for you to know that you can ONLY select the booking type using F9 or the drop-down menu. (Manually entering the word "Come" or "Go" has NO effect) So we select "Come" for Mr. Völkner We enter the date in the time-saving Cowis way with DDMM (without points and in the same year without a year, i.e. 2910) and press Enter We enter the time in the format HH:MM and press Enter Cowis.Net Office asks Create another data record (YES / No) We select YES and create the next data record, the start of the break We select the employee with the personnel number 1 again and press Enter Mr. Völkner went on break on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00, so we record a departure on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00 and when we press Enter Cowis.Net Backoffice asks whether the next data record should be recorded. We confirm this with Yes and then record the return from the break at 13:00 And to complete this manual recording, we record the final departure at 18:00 At the end of the manual recording, you have 4 entries (2 arrivals and 2 departures) And if you are unsure: do not hesitate to ask about a paid training course.
title: Time recording - correction - manual recording
description:
If the working hours have been recorded in the Cowiskasse, they are transferred to the Cowis.Net back office via data exchange.


The working hours can be found in the area

"Cash register closings" -> File -> Time recording




In this area it is possible to make corrections, delete entries or add them manually.

(To what extent this is permissible under working hour law, please ask a legal advisor)



Correct entry

Select the entry to be corrected with a click and then select Change (or F7)


The employee in this example has a verifiable start time of 7:55 a.m., so we change the 1st arrival entry of the day to the correct time.


After you have selected Change (or F7), press Enter until you are in the TIME cell and change the entry to the correct time.



Press Enter or save the entry with F2 or by clicking Save


When the entry has been saved, #### appears in the booking type, this is a hint for the user to make a manual change. (You may need to adjust the cell width)


You can also delete entries, select the entry to be deleted and use the F8 or Delete key.



Enter entry

If, for whatever reason, you are forced to enter an entry manually, proceed as follows.


Select NEW (or F5)

An empty line is created with the starting position on the personnel number


Either you know the employee number or you use the drop-down function or press F9 (that stands for list)


In this example, we only have 2 employees



We now enter working hours for Mr. Völkner on October 29, 2024 from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. with a break from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m.

A total of 4 entries are required for this


We select the seller and press Enter

The initial approach is that Cowis.Net suggests "Go".


As this makes no sense for the first booking, it is important for you to know that you can ONLY select the booking type using F9 or the drop-down menu. (Manually entering the word "Come" or "Go" has NO effect)

So we select "Come" for Mr. Völkner



We enter the date in the time-saving Cowis way with DDMM (without points and in the same year without a year, i.e. 2910) and press Enter


We enter the time in the format HH:MM and press Enter


Cowis.Net Office asks

Create another data record (YES / No)


We select YES and create the next data record, the start of the break

We select the employee with the personnel number 1 again and press Enter


Mr. Völkner went on break on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00, so we record a departure on October 29th, 2024 at 12:00 and when we press Enter Cowis.Net Backoffice asks whether the next data record should be recorded.

We confirm this with Yes and then record the return from the break at 13:00


And to complete this manual recording, we record the final departure at 18:00



At the end of the manual recording, you have 4 entries (2 arrivals and 2 departures)


And if you are unsure: do not hesitate to ask about a paid training course.

text: After you have recorded the working hours, the evaluation takes place. The evaluation of the time recording can either be done via the evaluations, or (which makes more sense) in the cash register closings (the evaluation is the same in both cases) We go into cash register closings Go to Print -> Evaluations -> Time recording You enter the date from - to and can go straight to OK without further ado The result is an overview list of all employees and their recorded working hours (In this example, only 2 days of 1 employee are recorded, we zoom in a bit) The times shown are net (i.e. breaks have already been deducted) The second option for the evaluation is the detailed evaluation per employee To do this, select in the "Print variant" field -> Individual salesperson. You will only see employees for whom working hours have been recorded This evaluation then looks like this If you have any questions or are unsure, please feel free to take advantage of our paid training offer.
title: Time recording - evaluation - analysis
description:
After you have recorded the working hours, the evaluation takes place.

The evaluation of the time recording can either be done via the evaluations, or (which makes more sense) in the cash register closings (the evaluation is the same in both cases)


We go into cash register closings




Go to Print -> Evaluations -> Time recording




You enter the date from - to and can go straight to OK without further ado



The result is an overview list of all employees and their recorded working hours



(In this example, only 2 days of 1 employee are recorded, we zoom in a bit)


The times shown are net (i.e. breaks have already been deducted)



The second option for the evaluation is the detailed evaluation per employee


To do this, select in the "Print variant" field -> Individual salesperson.


You will only see employees for whom working hours have been recorded




This evaluation then looks like this



If you have any questions or are unsure, please feel free to take advantage of our paid training offer.

text: Previously (Cowis.Net version 6.4.60 before November 5, 2024) in the Cowis.Net back office cash register closings there was only the option of displaying all branches or selecting a specific branch from the drop-down menu of the quick filter. Sometimes it happened that users entered several branches separated by commas in order to filter. This led to the problem that the cash register closings program area could no longer be opened afterwards. From the Cowis.Net back office program version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024 or later, it is possible to select several branches by activating checkboxes in the cash register closings area.
title: Selection by branches in the cash register closings
description:
Previously (Cowis.Net version 6.4.60 before November 5, 2024) in the Cowis.Net back office cash register closings there was only the option of displaying all branches or selecting a specific branch from the drop-down menu of the quick filter.


Sometimes it happened that users entered several branches separated by commas in order to filter. This led to the problem that the cash register closings program area could no longer be opened afterwards.

From the Cowis.Net back office program version 6.4.60 from November 5th, 2024 or later, it is possible to select several branches by activating checkboxes in the cash register closings area.

text: You can export articles in Cowis.Net. This creates an "ArtExp.dat" file which you can then import into Excel, for example. We do not offer any support beyond creating the export file. text: Dear customers When setting up the TSE, you were made aware that you have to register the cash registers with your responsible tax office. Depending on the federal state, you (or your tax advisor) received the information: this is not yet possible. In a letter dated June 28, 2024 from the BMF (Federal Ministry of Finance) to the highest financial authorities of the states (see link) Schreiben des BMF 28.06.2024 it is announced that electronic transmission will be made available from January 1, 2025. We, DdD retail Germany GmbH, are not responsible for reporting your cash registers to your tax office (to the best of our knowledge). The information you need to report your cash registers can be found in Cowis.Net Backoffice Cash register closings Extras -> other -> TSE Fiskaly Info Of course, your TSE info looks different Your tax advisor or your responsible tax office will tell you what to do with this information.
title: Start of the notification obligation according to Section 146a Paragraph 4 of the Fiscal Code (AO) (TSE notification)

text: Normally all sales figures are always displayed in Cowis.Net Backoffice. See screenshot There is a function in Cowis.Net Backoffice "Reset sales" (Article -> Extras -> Other -> Reset sales This resets the sales figures in the inventory management system. This does NOT mean that any turnover or sales are deleted, it is ONLY a "zeroing" of the sales figures displayed in the items area When you execute this function, you will be asked whether all articles or only the marked articles should be edited The number of sales from the day of the reset is then zero. This means that if you execute this function on March 6, 2025, you will see that the sales section is empty. Of course, all the sales figures are still there in the history and the evaluations. If you now go back to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can click on Total Sales Figures dann werden wieder alle seit Anbeginn verkauften Teile angezeigt If you go again to Articles -> Extras -> Other you can see that you can "switch on" that ONLY the sales figures since the date of the reset are displayed Why should So how do you reset sales? Some customers reset their sales figures on January 1st of each year so they can see what their current sales are, that's the only reason why you do it on schedule.
title: Reset sales figures
description:
Normally all sales figures are always displayed in Cowis.Net Backoffice. See screenshot



There is a function in Cowis.Net Backoffice

"Reset sales" (Article -> Extras -> Other -> Reset sales


This resets the sales figures in the inventory management system. This does NOT mean that any turnover or sales are deleted, it is ONLY a "zeroing" of the sales figures displayed in the items area

When you execute this function, you will be asked whether all articles or only the marked articles should be edited


The number of sales from the day of the reset is then zero. This means that if you execute this function on March 6, 2025, you will see that the sales section is empty.


Of course, all the sales figures are still there in the history and the evaluations.




If you now go back to Articles -> Extras -> Other

you can click on Total Sales Figures


dann werden wieder alle seit Anbeginn verkauften Teile angezeigt



If you go again to Articles -> Extras -> Other


you can see that you can "switch on" that ONLY the sales figures since the date of the reset are displayed




Why should So how do you reset sales?

Some customers reset their sales figures on January 1st of each year so they can see what their current sales are, that's the only reason why you do it on schedule.

text: If incorrect order backlog figures are displayed in the Items section, you can try to restore consistency by performing a check and correcting them. In the Cowis.Net back office, go to Items Extras Other Recalculate Order Backlog At the very bottom of the window, you'll see what Cowis.Net is currently doing. You may receive various pop-up messages (as in this example). Confirm by clicking OK. If the footer no longer displays anything, the consistency check is complete, and your order backlog should be correct. If not, please don't hesitate to create a ticket via the support portal.
title: Recalculate Order Backlog
description:
If incorrect order backlog figures are displayed in the Items section, you can try to restore consistency by performing a check and correcting them.


In the Cowis.Net back office, go to Items

Extras

Other

Recalculate Order Backlog





At the very bottom of the window, you'll see what Cowis.Net is currently doing.





You may receive various pop-up messages (as in this example).

Confirm by clicking OK.




If the footer no longer displays anything, the consistency check is complete, and your order backlog should be correct.

If not, please don't hesitate to create a ticket via the support portal.

text: If you have accidentally deleted a receipt of goods, you can recreate it by following these steps: First contact Support to get the daily password for Cowis. Log into your Backoffice Choose Service Choose Service -> Zugriffslisten -> Order Enter the Password you got from Cowis Support. Choose Wareneingang and OK Locate the delted receipt of goods, remove the tick and click OK. Now the receipt of goods has been restored and you can process it.
title: Recreating Receipt of Goods
description:
If you have accidentally deleted a receipt of goods, you can recreate it by following these steps:


First contact Support to get the daily password for Cowis.


Log into your Backoffice


Choose Service




Choose Service -> Zugriffslisten -> Order



Enter the Password you got from Cowis Support.



Choose Wareneingang and OK



Locate the delted receipt of goods, remove the tick and click OK.



Now the receipt of goods has been restored and you can process it.

Cowis->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten Entsprechende Kasse auswählen und mit "OK" bestätigen -> anschließend öffnet sich die Übersicht der Abrechnungszeiträume "Neu"->Name für den Zeitraum eintragen->"Von" und "bis" eintragen (Optimalerweise 1 Monat)->Solange "Enter"-Taste drücken bis "Weiteren Datensatz anlegen?" erscheint->mit "Nein" beantworten Doppelklick auf den erstellten Zeitraum und im anschließenden Pop-up Fenster "Ja" klicken Die Belege werden nun bearbeitet, was sich auch in der Zeile unten einsehen lässt. Dies kann einige Minuten dauern. Nach abgeschlossener Bearbeitung öffnet sich ein Fenster->"Zurück" klicken Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok->Ja Abrechnungsnummer bestätigen Druckvorschau schließen "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken" UNBEDINGT mit "Ja" beantworten. Ansonsten muss der Abrechnungszeitraum durch uns freigegeben werden. Anschließende Fragen/Pop-up Fenster bestätigen/mit "Ja" beantworten Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist. Wenn ein Sternchen "*" angezeigt wird, bedeutet das, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist. Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist. Wenn ein Sternchen "*" angezeigt wird, bedeutet das, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist. Wenn weder "A" noch das Sternchen "*" angezeigt werden, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum verbrannt und muss durch den Support freigegeben werden Abgeschlossene Abrechnungszeiträume lassen sich auch über das Cowis-Hauptmenü in der Fibu-Schnittstelle finden.
title: Abrechnungszeitraum erstellen Anleitung (Kassenbuchung)
description:
->B 1. Cowis->Kassenabschlüsse->Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Bearbeiten

  1. Entsprechende Kasse auswählen und mit "OK" bestätigen -> anschließend öffnet sich die Übersicht der Abrechnungszeiträume

  2. "Neu"->Name für den Zeitraum eintragen->"Von" und "bis" eintragen (Optimalerweise 1 Monat)->Solange "Enter"-Taste drücken bis "Weiteren Datensatz anlegen?" erscheint->mit "Nein" beantworten

  3. Doppelklick auf den erstellten Zeitraum und im anschließenden Pop-up Fenster "Ja" klicken
  4. Die Belege werden nun bearbeitet, was sich auch in der Zeile unten einsehen lässt. Dies kann einige Minuten dauern.

  5. Nach abgeschlossener Bearbeitung öffnet sich ein Fenster->"Zurück" klicken

  6. Extras->Kassenbuchungen Einnahmen & Ausgaben->Zeitraum abschließen->Ok->Ja



  7. Abrechnungsnummer bestätigen

  8. Druckvorschau schließen

  9. "Möchten Sie jetzt drucken" UNBEDINGT mit "Ja" beantworten. Ansonsten muss der Abrechnungszeitraum durch uns freigegeben werden.


  10. Anschließende Fragen/Pop-up Fenster bestätigen/mit "Ja" beantworten

  11. Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist.
    Wenn ein Sternchen "*" angezeigt wird, bedeutet das, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist.


Der Abrechnungszeitraum ist nun Abgeschlossen, was in der Übersicht im ersten Feld mit einem "A" ersichtlich ist.
Wenn ein Sternchen "*" angezeigt wird, bedeutet das, dass der Abrechnungszeitraum erstellt ist, aber noch nicht abgeschlossen ist. Wenn weder "A" noch das Sternchen "*" angezeigt werden, ist der Abrechnungszeitraum verbrannt und muss durch den Support freigegeben werden

 

Abgeschlossene Abrechnungszeiträume lassen sich auch über das Cowis-Hauptmenü in der Fibu-Schnittstelle finden.

text: To quickly and easily add special offers or other price changes to items, there is the "Automatic Price Change" feature. This can be found under Items -> Extras -> Booking / Edit Prices. First, select the items you want to add a special price (or price change). See also "Item Selection Options." Select the selected items (CTRL+a) or record -> select -> select all. Then go to Extras -> Book / Edit Prices -> Automatic Price Changes. If you receive a window with a currency query (customer-specific), select the appropriate currency. You will receive this window, in which you define the parameters for your desired price change. A field explanation can be found in a separate help article. In our example, we want to assign a special price to the selected item, which corresponds to a 30% reduction on the original selling price and is valid for the period June 15th - June 30th, 2025. (a duration is NOT mandatory, without a time specification the special price always applies until you remove it, with a date specification the special price only applies in this date range) After clicking OK, this window will appear, and the price change is complete. You can then uncheck the items. The special price will be displayed here, depending on your configuration. Otherwise, you can also find it in the item report list in the SP column.
title: Price Changes / Special Prices
description:
To quickly and easily add special offers or other price changes to items, there is the "Automatic Price Change" feature.


This can be found under Items -> Extras -> Booking / Edit Prices.



First, select the items you want to add a special price (or price change).


See also "Item Selection Options."


Select the selected items (CTRL+a) or record -> select -> select all.






Then go to Extras -> Book / Edit Prices -> Automatic Price Changes.


If you receive a window with a currency query (customer-specific), select the appropriate currency.




You will receive this window, in which you define the parameters for your desired price change.



A field explanation can be found in a separate help article.


In our example, we want to assign a special price to the selected item, which corresponds to a 30% reduction on the original selling price and is valid for the period June 15th - June 30th, 2025.

(a duration is NOT mandatory, without a time specification the special price always applies until you remove it, with a date specification the special price only applies in this date range)





After clicking OK, this window will appear, and the price change is complete.

You can then uncheck the items.


The special price will be displayed here, depending on your configuration.

Otherwise, you can also find it in the item report list in the SP column.

text: Cowis.Net does not export directly to Excel, but always creates a TXT file which you have to import into Excel. If you create an evaluation, tick the “Excel Export” checkbox. After the evaluation has been calculated, Cowis.Net must open a storage dialog (see image) If you do NOT see this save dialog, support must first activate the function. Function is activated: If the function is activated and you see the save dialog, enter a meaningful name for the file, leave the ending .TXT and save the export file. The file is available to you in the selected directory and you can import it into Excel
title: How to export a report to Excel
description:
Cowis.Net does not export directly to Excel, but always creates a TXT file which you have to import into Excel.


If you create an evaluation, tick the “Excel Export” checkbox.



After the evaluation has been calculated, Cowis.Net must open a storage dialog (see image)

If you do NOT see this save dialog, support must first activate the function.




Function is activated:

If the function is activated and you see the save dialog, enter a meaningful name for the file, leave the ending .TXT and save the export file.


The file is available to you in the selected directory and you can import it into Excel

text: The quickest way is the classic “warehouse, goods receipt and issue” evaluation. Once you have reached the classic evaluations, click on “New” or use “F5”. Then select the “warehouse, goods receipt and issue” report. If you only care about inventory as of today, fill in the date range from to with today's date. The top evaluation level is always “branch” (i.e. your company). You set this by using the drop-down menu in the breakdown and selecting the branch item. That's all you need to enter as basic information, all other fields are optional and are explained in a separate help area. Now click on OK or use F2 and the evaluation will be calculated. The result is an evaluation that shows you your current inventory in units, purchases and sales in the last three columns, broken down into your individual branches (if you have them) and the total. You can also put this on paper using the menu item Print -> Dataset.
title: What is the fastest way to evaluate the inventory?
description:
The quickest way is the classic “warehouse, goods receipt and issue” evaluation.


Once you have reached the classic evaluations, click on “New” or use “F5”.



Then select the “warehouse, goods receipt and issue” report.


If you only care about inventory as of today, fill in the date range from to with today's date.


The top evaluation level is always “branch” (i.e. your company). You set this by using the drop-down menu in the breakdown and selecting the branch item.


That's all you need to enter as basic information, all other fields are optional and are explained in a separate help area.


Now click on OK or use F2 and the evaluation will be calculated.



The result is an evaluation that shows you your current inventory in units, purchases and sales in the last three columns, broken down into your individual branches (if you have them) and the total.


You can also put this on paper using the menu item Print -> Dataset.

text: Wenn das MDE-Gerät zum Start einer Inventur nicht richtig mit der Kasse verbunden ist, können Sie folgende Schritte vornehmen: 1. Öffnen Sie "Funktion" in der Kasse 2. Klicken Sie anschließend auf System -> Kassenparameter 3. Klicken Sie anschließend auf "Alle Parameter" 4. Geben Sie im Suchfeld "SvMDeComPort" ein und bestätigen Sie mit der Eingabetaste (Enter) 5. Finde Sie den Parameter anhand den Werten "Typ" und "Dat" und klicken Sie diesen an 6. Geben Sie im Eingabefeld rechts oben die richtige ComPort Nummer ein Die richtige ComPort Nummer finden Sie im Windows Gerätemanager: - Drücken Sie die Tastenkombination "Windows-Logo" + "x" - Klicken Sie auf "Geräte-Manager" - Klicken Sie per Doppelklick auf "Anschlüsse" - Nun sehen Sie unter welchem ComPort das MDE-Gerät mit dem Namen "Silicon Labs..." angeschlossen ist. Wenn Sie sich unsicher sind, stecken Sie das MDE-Gerät aus und anschließend wieder ein und beobachten Sie welcher ComPort im Geräte-Manager verschwindet und wieder auftaucht. Handelt es sich beispielsweise wie im folgenden Screenshot um COM7, so müssen Sie im Eingabefeld in der Kasse (wie oben beschrieben) die Zahl "7" ein. Klicken Sie nach Eingabe der richtigen ComPort Nummer in der Kasse auf "OK" und anschließend auf "Speichern" Die Kasse startet sich nun automatisch neu und sollte das MDE-Gerät nun erkennen. Kontaktieren Sie den K3 Support, falls es dennoch nicht funktioniert.
title: Inventur Datenübertrabung: MDE-Gerät wird von Kasse nicht erkannt
description:
Wenn das MDE-Gerät zum Start einer Inventur nicht richtig mit der Kasse verbunden ist, können Sie folgende Schritte vornehmen:



1. Öffnen Sie "Funktion" in der Kasse

 

 

2. Klicken Sie anschließend auf System -> Kassenparameter

 

 

3. Klicken Sie anschließend auf "Alle Parameter"


4. Geben Sie im Suchfeld "SvMDeComPort" ein und bestätigen Sie mit der Eingabetaste (Enter)


5. Finde Sie den Parameter anhand den Werten "Typ" und "Dat" und klicken Sie diesen an

 

6. Geben Sie im Eingabefeld rechts oben die richtige ComPort Nummer ein


Die richtige ComPort Nummer finden Sie im Windows Gerätemanager:

- Drücken Sie die Tastenkombination "Windows-Logo" + "x"

- Klicken Sie auf "Geräte-Manager"

- Klicken Sie per Doppelklick auf "Anschlüsse"

- Nun sehen Sie unter welchem ComPort das MDE-Gerät mit dem Namen "Silicon Labs..." angeschlossen ist. Wenn Sie sich unsicher sind, stecken Sie das MDE-Gerät aus und anschließend wieder ein und beobachten Sie welcher ComPort im Geräte-Manager verschwindet und wieder auftaucht. Handelt es sich beispielsweise wie im folgenden Screenshot um COM7, so müssen Sie im Eingabefeld in der Kasse (wie oben beschrieben) die Zahl "7" ein.

Klicken Sie nach Eingabe der richtigen ComPort Nummer in der Kasse auf "OK" und anschließend auf "Speichern"

 

 

Die Kasse startet sich nun automatisch neu und sollte das MDE-Gerät nun erkennen. Kontaktieren Sie den K3 Support, falls es dennoch nicht funktioniert.

text: 1. Definition Stocktaking is the recording of the quantity and value of all items actually present in the store. The value of the determined stock is a basis for the administration of the company and the tax authorities. For the tax office, the annual number of stocktakes carried out counts in order to check the stock corrections in terms of quantity and to confirm the stock for the annual financial statements. The stock corrections are intended to adjust the theoretical stock (in DdD Cowis backoffice) to the actual stock (in the store). This provides a basis for business management considerations of the store and simplifies restocking with goods. 2. Inventory tasks The first task of the inventory is a "target/actual comparison", with which differences between the stock of goods in DdD Cowis backoffice and the counted goods can be corrected. Such differences can arise due to Shrinkage: Handling errors by DdD Cowis backoffice or DdD Cowis pos, e.g: exchanges that were not booked back into Cowis and sold repeatedly Incorrect or "forgotten" store stock transfer Incorrect goods receipt A "target/actual comparison" can also be carried out as an inventory sampling in the current financial year, independently of the annual inventory. The principle is based on including all goods in stock on the day of the inventory (see "Inventory key date") in the inventory list. This inventory can include the entire range of goods. However, it is also possible to carry out a partial inventory. The second task is to print an inventory list for the balance sheet. In the inventory list, the stock of goods can be valued according to age groups, i.e. you can make the corresponding value corrections here. 3. Preparation in the stores Timely preparation of the stocktake is particularly important. In fact, preparation should begin as soon as the last stocktake has been completed. After each stocktake, all errors and deficiencies that have crept in should be recorded in writing in order to prevent the same errors from occurring again during the next stocktake. The actual preparation, however, should begin at least two months before the stocktaking. The better and more careful the preparation, the quicker the stocktaking will be and the more reliable the stocktaking will be. The basis for the preparation and recording phase is an inventory calendar.
title: Inventory with Cowis.Net Backoffice
description:
1. Definition

 

Stocktaking is the recording of the quantity and value of all items actually present in the store.


The value of the determined stock is a basis for the administration of the company and the tax authorities. For the tax office, the annual number of stocktakes carried out counts in order to check the stock corrections in terms of quantity and to confirm the stock for the annual financial statements.


The stock corrections are intended to adjust the theoretical stock (in DdD Cowis backoffice) to the actual stock (in the store). This provides a basis for business management considerations of the store and simplifies restocking with goods.


2. Inventory tasks

 

The first task of the inventory is a "target/actual comparison", with which differences between the stock of goods in DdD Cowis backoffice and the counted goods can be corrected. Such differences can arise due to


Shrinkage:

Handling errors by DdD Cowis backoffice or DdD Cowis pos, e.g:

exchanges that were not booked back into Cowis and sold repeatedly

Incorrect or "forgotten" store stock transfer

Incorrect goods receipt

A "target/actual comparison" can also be carried out as an inventory sampling in the current financial year, independently of the annual inventory.


The principle is based on including all goods in stock on the day of the inventory (see "Inventory key date") in the inventory list. This inventory can include the entire range of goods. However, it is also possible to carry out a partial inventory.


The second task is to print an inventory list for the balance sheet. In the inventory list, the stock of goods can be valued according to age groups, i.e. you can make the corresponding value corrections here.



3. Preparation in the stores


Timely preparation of the stocktake is particularly important. In fact, preparation should begin as soon as the last stocktake has been completed. After each stocktake, all errors and deficiencies that have crept in should be recorded in writing in order to prevent the same errors from occurring again during the next stocktake. The actual preparation, however, should begin at least two months before the stocktaking. The better and more careful the preparation, the quicker the stocktaking will be and the more reliable the stocktaking will be. The basis for the preparation and recording phase is an inventory calendar.

text: Stocktaking How is the inventory data transferred from DdD Cowis pos to DdD Cowis backoffice? The data is transferred to COWIS using the "normal data exchange". You can see whether all data has been transferred by looking at the "Status" field in the inventory entry screen of the cash register. Inventory recording at the checkout counter Reference to deleted items in the inventory When entering an inventory, items that have already been deleted in Cowis can also be scanned at the checkout. As a result, these items are not displayed in the inventory in Cowis. In the past, this has resulted in differences in the quantities of the items concerned. In future, if an inventory with deleted items is read into Cowis from the cash register, a log will be displayed when entering the inventory area, which provides information about the items and their respective number of unaccounted counts. The red-colored info at the beginning of the log informs you in future about unknown recorded articles How can the inventory data be deleted from DdD Cowis pos and in DdD Cowis backoffice? The "old" inventory data can be deleted both in DdD Cowis backoffice and in DdD Cowis pos. In DdD Cowis pos, the inventory is recorded under "Function" in the "Data" tab using the "Record inventory" button. Here, existing inventory data can be deleted using the "Delete inventory" button. In DdD Cowis backoffice there is the menu item "Extras/Delete inventory data" in the Inventory area. How can an inventory be saved? You can save (export) an existing inventory under a freely selectable file name (e.g. c:\cowis\inv2011.txt) or read (import) a saved inventory in DdD Cowis backoffice under the menu item "Extras/Miscellaneous/Export/Import inventory". How is an inventory calculated back to December 31? Procedure: Confirm the "Inventory" item in the main menu. You are now in the inventory list, which should be empty. If old inventory data is still available, you will be asked whether this data should be deleted or not before the inventory is calculated. Then select the item "Extras/Other/Calculate inventory from master". After confirming this menu item, you will receive an information window and after confirming, you will be asked for the calculation date. Use the 01.01. of the year so that all postings that have been created on 31.12. are included. If this field is left blank, DdD Cowis backoffice takes the current date as the calculation date, i.e. the quantity of goods currently in stock is taken. If, however, you enter a date, the stocks that were in DdD Cowis backoffice on the morning of that day will be listed. Once the inventory list has been generated, the parts (items) can be valued and marked down. Note: When calculating an inventory, any inventory corrections made are not taken into account by the "target/actual comparison". Master calculations separable by branch and "Already taken over" feature The inventory area of Cowis has been revised. New features: The option "Calculate inventory from master" can now be carried out on individual stores. When creating a difference list, the user is warned if he wants to create difference lists for stores for which no inventory data has been recorded. The items in the inventory area now have an "already completed" status. A new column has been introduced for this purpose. If the stocktake is completed, i.e. the stocks are transferred, all entries are marked as "completed". Entries that have already been completed will NOT be taken into account for a further differences list and stock transfer! When creating a differences list, the user is now warned if there are "already completed" items in the inventory list. If you do not enter a key date when creating the differences list, the process is canceled. No difference list can be created without a key date! Option for store-specific calculation from the article master data New column: "Already adopted" Warning of difference list printout regarding unequal branches and "already completed" entries How can I calculate an inventory for a specific date? How are selections handled? An inventory can be calculated for any date from the article master. To do this, call up the menu item "Extras/Miscellaneous/Calculate inventory from master". You will then be asked for a calculation date. You can then specify whether selected items should be included in the inventory on this date. How do I take an inventory over several days? If you cannot take a complete inventory in one day, the inventory reference date is decisive. Everything that is in your store at the start of the inventory must be included in the inventory. Even if the stocktake takes place over several days, the stock that was present at the start of the stocktake always applies. This means that goods that are sold and have not yet been included in the inventory must be recorded manually. What happens to goods deliveries and sales during stocktaking? All parts that are sold during the inventory must be recorded. The following applies: what is in the shop/warehouse at the start of the inventory belongs in the inventory. This means that deliveries of goods that you received after the start of the physical inventory may not be included in the physical inventory. Note: If you post and label these goods deliveries, you could mark the labels with a colored dot, for example, so that you can distinguish these parts from the others. What about selections during the physical inventory? If you hand in selections during the physical inventory, these must be included in the physical inventory beforehand, as these parts were present in your stock at the start of the physical inventory. Selections that are returned during this time do not belong in the inventory, as they were not in the store/warehouse at the start of the inventory. Please also note the question on the previous page "How can I calculate an inventory on a specific date and how are selections treated? How is the inventory recorded in the mobile DdD Cowis backoffice? Stocktaking in the mobile DdD Cowis backoffice (laptop) is carried out in exactly the same way as at the COWIS head office. The data is transferred from the laptop to the head office using the normal data synchronization process. Stocktaking in several stores Differences due to incorrect or missing "store transfer" of goods. Should a "store transfer posting" be made retrospectively instead of an inventory correction? The answer to this question should actually be "yes", as the transfers can also be found in the statistics. But of course this means too much effort if you have several stores over a longer period of time. You should draw the attention of your sales staff to errors in advance by carrying out inventory spot checks and "educate" them to be more conscientious. How can you delete incorrectly transferred stock? It sometimes happens that incorrect stocks are transferred from the inventory to the item stock. To delete these corrections, you must first switch to the item master and select the menu item "Extras/posting/single posting". Now press the key combination "Shift-F9". You are now You are now in the "Movement history", i.e. all postings are listed here one after the other according to their date or time of origin. Find the inventory corrections (booking type "IK") for the corresponding day, select them and delete these bookings using the "F8" key or under "Data record/delete". Tips for recording with the MDE device If the COWIS inventory is recorded using an MDE device, please note the following information: The MDE device does not "know" the barcodes that you scan from the items. You can therefore also scan any barcode with the MDE device. There is no error message when scanning, but the MDE device accepts the barcode. This is particularly important if you are working with manufacturer barcodes. Incorrect or invalid codes are only recognized when you read the data into DdD Cowis backoffice. We therefore recommend the following procedure: Divide the inventory locations into small manageable units. Use the "COWIS inventory location" form from the appendix for each inventory location and count the number of items as a check BEFORE entering the goods. Tip: The check count when determining the inventory locations should not be carried out by the same person as the subsequent recording with the MDE device. Otherwise, the probability of the same item being overlooked twice is too high. Record the items with the PDC unit. Take the "Inventory recording location" form with you to the read-in station and read the data from the PDC unit into DdD Cowis backoffice. You will receive a read-in log with the number of "valid barcodes" with the manually counted check total. In the event of differences, you should not have the data processed in DdD Cowis backoffice, but should repeat the recording of this inventory location carefully. Further processing of the inventory How are the age groups for the deductions entered? How can automatic or manual markdowns be entered? The age groups for the automatic discounting of goods are entered under the menu item "File/Discounts after goods receipt". Here you can enter the period and the percentages. For example, if you enter 1 month / 5% and 2 months / 10%, all items that had their last goods receipt between one and two months after the calculation date (you can enter this when you call up "Extras/Automatic markdown") will be marked down by 5%. All articles whose last goods receipt was more than 2 months ago are then written off at 10%. For manual markdowns, you should first select the desired items (e.g. a product group) in the inventory list, mark them and then call up the menu item "Extras/Manual markdown". Here you can then enter either a percentage markdown (all parts are marked down by this percentage) or a total after markdown (the total is allocated to all parts as a percentage). How is an inventory list printed out (by branch)? The inventory list can be created by calling up the menu item "Print/Inventory list". You will then see a screen in which you can specify whether the list should be limited to one store. By entering merchandise group locations, you can specify how precisely the list of items should be broken down by merchandise group. Delimitation of goods on consignment To ensure that goods on consignment in DdD Cowis backoffice can be given special consideration in the inventory (e.g. when printing out the inventory list), the items must be specially marked in DdD Cowis backoffice, e.g. using a special keyword field. This allows a separate difference list to be created for these goods (selection according to this keyword field). An item list can be created for these goods to delimit the value of the goods in accounting. How is a list of age groups printed out? You can obtain a list of the age groups (discount rates) under the menu item "Print/Specials/Overview by age group". Difference list How is a difference list created? How can the differences list be limited to individual stores? To create the difference list, confirm the menu item "Inventory/Extras/Create difference list". In the subsequent "Selection" screen, the date of the first inventory day must be entered in the "Key date" field. If you want to create a difference list for a specific store, you must enter or select it in the "Store" field. Once the difference list has been created, the "Transfer stock" menu item is active. Please note that the "Transfer stocks" item always refers to the previously created differences list. To be on the safe side, this only applies as long as DdD Cowis backoffice is open. After a restart, you must first create a difference list again. What is the key date? A stocktake is always a snapshot of your inventory. However, this changes in the course of the stocktaking, provided that business operations continue. For DdD Cowis backoffice, the moment of inventory is the morning of the inventory date. This means that all items that are or were in your stock on the morning of the inventory date must be included in the inventory. So if you start the inventory in the morning, it's quite simple: the key date is the morning of the day on which you started the inventory. However, if you start the inventory in the evening after closing time, for example, the reference date is the following day, as the inventory in the evening is the same as the inventory in the morning of the following day. How do you work with different cut-off dates if, for example, you take stock of several stores in succession on different days? If you take stock in several stores on different days, there are of course several cut-off dates. Here you must pay particular attention to which day you started in which store so that the correct key date is entered when creating the difference lists for the different stores. Can an inventory only be taken for part of the goods? The goods can be inventoried completely or in parts. Here it is important that you also "inform" DdD Cowis backoffice when creating the differences list that it is not a complete inventory (by default, DdD Cowis backoffice assumes a complete inventory). To do this, you can either work with a selection when creating the list of differences or activate the "Partial inventory" switch. For further details, please refer to the documentation under "Difference list - partial inventory". Danger of partial inventories, items not counted are not corrected to zero. If you carry out an inventory with DdD Cowis backoffice and activate the "Partial inventory" switch when creating the difference list, this means that items that no longer have any stock, but have a stock greater than zero in DdD Cowis backoffice and were therefore not counted during the inventory (e.g. because the item was stolen) are not changed in the stock. Only those items that have been included in the inventory list at least once are taken into account in the partial inventory. If you want to correct these items definitively, you must give DdD Cowis backoffice the opportunity to recognize them. This can be done, for example, via a partial inventory of one (or more) suppliers or one (or more) product groups. When creating the differences list, you can then select the merchandise categories or suppliers in the selection mask and leave the "Partial inventory" switch deactivated. Where do inventory differences come from? Why is it so important to clear negative stock levels (or clarify the errors) before the inventory? Negative stock levels are an indication of errors in the workflow with DdD Cowis backoffice. The most common causes of negative stock levels are Incorrect store stock transfers (not posted or posted to the wrong store). Incorrect procedure for exchanges or complaints at the checkout. Incorrect definition of "with goods movement" for returns. Poorly recorded inventory from the previous year (parts were not or not completely included in the inventory). Goods receipts were posted to the wrong store (e.g. to the warehouse instead of directly to the sales store). Before the stocktake, you should always clarify the negative stocks in the stores and correct them if necessary (make up for store stock transfers, check returns and goods receipts) What causes negative stock levels shortly after a stock transfer? If there are negative item stocks directly after an inventory and stock transfer, these parts were probably forgotten to be included in the inventory. The item stock was therefore corrected downwards and when these parts are subsequently sold, the stock goes into the negative. In this case, you should either make a manual stock correction or (if you have the appropriate authorization) delete the previously created inventory correction postings. In the following example, an item was delivered in 2 sizes (XL and L) on 18.12.2011 and size L was forgotten to be counted in the physical inventory. The stocks were transferred on 01.01.2012 (IK posting is created by DdD Cowis backoffice one day earlier, i.e. on 31.12.2011) and then both sizes were sold on 05.01.2004. This naturally results in negative stock in size L, as this item was sold although it was not normally in stock.
title: Inventory - FAQ - The most frequently asked questions
description:
Stocktaking

How is the inventory data transferred from DdD Cowis pos to DdD Cowis backoffice?


The data is transferred to COWIS using the "normal data exchange". You can see whether all data has been transferred by looking at the "Status" field in the inventory entry screen of the cash register.

Inventory recording at the checkout counter


Reference to deleted items in the inventory


When entering an inventory, items that have already been deleted in Cowis can also be scanned at the checkout. As a result, these items are not displayed in the inventory in Cowis. In the past, this has resulted in differences in the quantities of the items concerned. 

In future, if an inventory with deleted items is read into Cowis from the cash register, a log will be displayed when entering the inventory area, which provides information about the items and their respective number of unaccounted counts.

The red-colored info at the beginning of the log informs you in future about unknown recorded articles



How can the inventory data be deleted from DdD Cowis pos and in DdD Cowis backoffice?


The "old" inventory data can be deleted both in DdD Cowis backoffice and in DdD Cowis pos.


In DdD Cowis pos, the inventory is recorded under "Function" in the "Data" tab using the "Record inventory" button. Here, existing inventory data can be deleted using the "Delete inventory" button.

In DdD Cowis backoffice there is the menu item "Extras/Delete inventory data" in the Inventory area.



How can an inventory be saved?


You can save (export) an existing inventory under a freely selectable file name (e.g. c:\cowis\inv2011.txt) or read (import) a saved inventory in DdD Cowis backoffice under the menu item "Extras/Miscellaneous/Export/Import inventory".




How is an inventory calculated back to December 31?


Procedure:


Confirm the "Inventory" item in the main menu.

You are now in the inventory list, which should be empty. If old inventory data is still available, you will be asked whether this data should be deleted or not before the inventory is calculated.

Then select the item "Extras/Other/Calculate inventory from master".

After confirming this menu item, you will receive an information window and after confirming, you will be asked for the calculation date. Use the 01.01. of the year so that all postings that have been created on 31.12. are included. If this field is left blank, DdD Cowis backoffice takes the current date as the calculation date, i.e. the quantity of goods currently in stock is taken. If, however, you enter a date, the stocks that were in DdD Cowis backoffice on the morning of that day will be listed.

Once the inventory list has been generated, the parts (items) can be valued and marked down.

Note:

When calculating an inventory, any inventory corrections made are not taken into account by the "target/actual comparison".




Master calculations separable by branch and "Already taken over" feature

The inventory area of Cowis has been revised. New features:


The option "Calculate inventory from master" can now be carried out on individual stores.

When creating a difference list, the user is warned if he wants to create difference lists for stores for which no inventory data has been recorded.

The items in the inventory area now have an "already completed" status. A new column has been introduced for this purpose. If the stocktake is completed, i.e. the stocks are transferred, all entries are marked as "completed". Entries that have already been completed will NOT be taken into account for a further differences list and stock transfer!

When creating a differences list, the user is now warned if there are "already completed" items in the inventory list.

If you do not enter a key date when creating the differences list, the process is canceled. No difference list can be created without a key date!

Option for store-specific calculation from the article master data


New column: "Already adopted"


Warning of difference list printout regarding unequal branches and "already completed" entries




How can I calculate an inventory for a specific date?

How are selections handled? An inventory can be calculated for any date from the article master. To do this, call up the menu item "Extras/Miscellaneous/Calculate inventory from master". You will then be asked for a calculation date. You can then specify whether selected items should be included in the inventory on this date.


How do I take an inventory over several days?


If you cannot take a complete inventory in one day, the inventory reference date is decisive. Everything that is in your store at the start of the inventory must be included in the inventory. Even if the stocktake takes place over several days, the stock that was present at the start of the stocktake always applies. This means that goods that are sold and have not yet been included in the inventory must be recorded manually.



What happens to goods deliveries and sales during stocktaking?


All parts that are sold during the inventory must be recorded. The following applies: what is in the shop/warehouse at the start of the inventory belongs in the inventory. This means that deliveries of goods that you received after the start of the physical inventory may not be included in the physical inventory.


Note:


If you post and label these goods deliveries, you could mark the labels with a colored dot, for example, so that you can distinguish these parts from the others.



What about selections during the physical inventory?


If you hand in selections during the physical inventory, these must be included in the physical inventory beforehand, as these parts were present in your stock at the start of the physical inventory. Selections that are returned during this time do not belong in the inventory, as they were not in the store/warehouse at the start of the inventory. Please also note the question on the previous page "How can I calculate an inventory on a specific date and how are selections treated?



How is the inventory recorded in the mobile DdD Cowis backoffice?


Stocktaking in the mobile DdD Cowis backoffice (laptop) is carried out in exactly the same way as at the COWIS head office. The data is transferred from the laptop to the head office using the normal data synchronization process.



Stocktaking in several stores

The answer to this question should actually be "yes", as the transfers can also be found in the statistics. But of course this means too much effort if you have several stores over a longer period of time. You should draw the attention of your sales staff to errors in advance by carrying out inventory spot checks and "educate" them to be more conscientious.

If the COWIS inventory is recorded using an MDE device, please note the following information:


The MDE device does not "know" the barcodes that you scan from the items. You can therefore also scan any barcode with the MDE device. There is no error message when scanning, but the MDE device accepts the barcode. This is particularly important if you are working with manufacturer barcodes. Incorrect or invalid codes are only recognized when you read the data into DdD Cowis backoffice. We therefore recommend the following procedure:

Divide the inventory locations into small manageable units.

Use the "COWIS inventory location" form from the appendix for each inventory location and count the number of items as a check BEFORE entering the goods.

Tip:

The check count when determining the inventory locations should not be carried out by the same person as the subsequent recording with the MDE device. Otherwise, the probability of the same item being overlooked twice is too high.

Record the items with the PDC unit.

Take the "Inventory recording location" form with you to the read-in station and read the data from the PDC unit into DdD Cowis backoffice. You will receive a read-in log with the number of "valid barcodes" with the manually counted check total.

In the event of differences, you should not have the data processed in DdD Cowis backoffice, but should repeat the recording of this inventory location carefully.



Further processing of the inventory


How are the age groups for the deductions entered?

How can automatic or manual markdowns be entered?



The age groups for the automatic discounting of goods are entered under the menu item "File/Discounts after goods receipt". Here you can enter the period and the percentages. For example, if you enter 1 month / 5% and 2 months / 10%, all items that had their last goods receipt between one and two months after the calculation date (you can enter this when you call up "Extras/Automatic markdown") will be marked down by 5%. All articles whose last goods receipt was more than 2 months ago are then written off at 10%.



For manual markdowns, you should first select the desired items (e.g. a product group) in the inventory list, mark them and then call up the menu item "Extras/Manual markdown". Here you can then enter either a percentage markdown (all parts are marked down by this percentage) or a total after markdown (the total is allocated to all parts as a percentage).



How is an inventory list printed out (by branch)?


The inventory list can be created by calling up the menu item "Print/Inventory list". You will then see a screen in which you can specify whether the list should be limited to one store. By entering merchandise group locations, you can specify how precisely the list of items should be broken down by merchandise group.



Delimitation of goods on consignment


To ensure that goods on consignment in DdD Cowis backoffice can be given special consideration in the inventory (e.g. when printing out the inventory list), the items must be specially marked in DdD Cowis backoffice, e.g. using a special keyword field. This allows a separate difference list to be created for these goods (selection according to this keyword field). An item list can be created for these goods to delimit the value of the goods in accounting.



How is a list of age groups printed out?


You can obtain a list of the age groups (discount rates) under the menu item "Print/Specials/Overview by age group".



Difference list


How is a difference list created? How can the differences list be limited to individual stores?


To create the difference list, confirm the menu item "Inventory/Extras/Create difference list". In the subsequent "Selection" screen, the date of the first inventory day must be entered in the "Key date" field. If you want to create a difference list for a specific store, you must enter or select it in the "Store" field. Once the difference list has been created, the "Transfer stock" menu item is active. Please note that the "Transfer stocks" item always refers to the previously created differences list. To be on the safe side, this only applies as long as DdD Cowis backoffice is open. After a restart, you must first create a difference list again.



What is the key date?


A stocktake is always a snapshot of your inventory. However, this changes in the course of the stocktaking, provided that business operations continue. For DdD Cowis backoffice, the moment of inventory is the morning of the inventory date. This means that all items that are or were in your stock on the morning of the inventory date must be included in the inventory. So if you start the inventory in the morning, it's quite simple: the key date is the morning of the day on which you started the inventory. However, if you start the inventory in the evening after closing time, for example, the reference date is the following day, as the inventory in the evening is the same as the inventory in the morning of the following day.

If you take stock in several stores on different days, there are of course several cut-off dates. Here you must pay particular attention to which day you started in which store so that the correct key date is entered when creating the difference lists for the different stores.

The goods can be inventoried completely or in parts. Here it is important that you also "inform" DdD Cowis backoffice when creating the differences list that it is not a complete inventory (by default, DdD Cowis backoffice assumes a complete inventory). To do this, you can either work with a selection when creating the list of differences or activate the "Partial inventory" switch. For further details, please refer to the documentation under "Difference list - partial inventory".

If you carry out an inventory with DdD Cowis backoffice and activate the "Partial inventory" switch when creating the difference list, this means that items that no longer have any stock, but have a stock greater than zero in DdD Cowis backoffice and were therefore not counted during the inventory (e.g. because the item was stolen) are not changed in the stock. Only those items that have been included in the inventory list at least once are taken into account in the partial inventory. If you want to correct these items definitively, you must give DdD Cowis backoffice the opportunity to recognize them. This can be done, for example, via a partial inventory of one (or more) suppliers or one (or more) product groups. When creating the differences list, you can then select the merchandise categories or suppliers in the selection mask and leave the "Partial inventory" switch deactivated.




Where do inventory differences come from?

Why is it so important to clear negative stock levels (or clarify the errors) before the inventory?


Negative stock levels are an indication of errors in the workflow with DdD Cowis backoffice.

The most common causes of negative stock levels are


Incorrect store stock transfers (not posted or posted to the wrong store).

Incorrect procedure for exchanges or complaints at the checkout.

Incorrect definition of "with goods movement" for returns.
